column1: Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: Tesla;4/13/2017;"For Immediate ReleaseChicago
column2: IL - April 13
column3: 2017 - Today
column4: Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights Features:Tesla(NASDAQ:TSLA-Free Report).Ride Tesla (TSLA) to $450 and Beyond!I am calling forTesla(NASDAQ:TSLA-Free Report) to reach $450 within a year from now. That is not a typo
column5: it is fully $125 ahead of the highest price target on the street. Dougherty's Charlie Anderson put a price target of $375 on the stock back on 2/23/17 when he reiterated his buy rating.My call for such a big move in the stock comes from a solid foundation. The most important part of the foundation is the reason investors put their money into a stock - they expect the value of the company to rise.There are dozens upon dozens of ways to value a company. When you boil it down there are two basic methods growth or value. If you are a value investor you can probably stop right here as you focus on the past performance and want to see some sort of ""distress"" from which an investment can come back from.Is Growth Enough?Lately we have seen a few analysts talk about TSLA and do so in some rather strange terms. Last week we had the Barclays analyst who has been bearish on the stock for year reiterate a sell rating and a $165 price target. The report talked about a red pill / blue pill scenario in which you either except the idea of ""valuations"" or you live in a world where infinite growth is possible. The analyst noted that ""we don't think 1Q EPS will matter
column6: and while Model 3 hype is baked in
column7: it could drive another leg up.""When you have one of the most bearish analysts in the name suggesting another leg up will come with earnings you have to wonder how much more the bears can withstand. The answer is a lot.Short InterestTSLA has a lot of ""naysayers"" and it is not something new. I was looking at the short interest as reported on the NASDAQ site and then compared it to the stock price. I charted the shares sold short and the price of TSLA at the close on the corresponding day.As the share price moved higher from November 1 through the end of January the shorts were hammered
column8: but they added to their positions.The first meaningful decrease in the short position happened in mid February. It took the 1Q delivery numbers for TSLA to send the stock over $300 per share
column9: but if you have been looking at social media at all
column10: you have to get the feeling that the shorts are now pressing their bets.ValuationsNo earnings for TSLA means that we can't really value them on trailing or forward multiple. GM and F both have some paltry numbers in terms of earnings multiples especially when looking at the industry average.But the market is kind of funny when it comes to how it looks at growth. It really likes company's that grow revenue and earnings.Seems that this year is going to be pretty good for TSLA and the other two well not so much. Next year looks like earnings will take a big step forward for TSLA while there is going to be a broader move higher according the analyst reports.Recent Attack on the BoardI giggled a little when I saw a recent article that talked about how investors want more board members with fewer ties to Elon Musk. I know it is not everyday that the CEO has his brother on the board
column11: so I get that argument
column12: but it really starts and stops there.Whenever there is talk about increased corporate governance
column13: we always hear about the steps that Cal (PERS) and Cal State Teachers Retirement System (STRS) are taking. Yes
column14: these are big investment funds and you would think they would be looking to support the companies in their own back yard - but you would be wrong. Like any investor
column15: they don't care too much about the location of a company
column16: they care about the returns they get from it. Yet
column17: those names popped up in recent discussion.I took at look to see where this big time investors ranked in terms of TSLA shareholders. I scrolled through 3 screens find Cal PERS which owned 308K (a decrease of 8.6K shares from the last report) shares and STRS which had 259K shares ( a nearly 7K decrease from the last report).Seems they have a very small position to get this much press about the board. Their position seems tiny compared to that of Fidelity at 22M shares or T Rowe Price at 11M shares or even the recent investment by Tencent of 8M shares.The Board is Elon Musk and for good reason. He is the biggest shareholder and get this
column18: he is buying not selling!According to Finviz
column19: Musk holds about 33.6M shares
column20: making him the single largest shareholder by a wide margin. Musk recently added to his position in a secondary offering
column21: buying $25M worth of stock at $262.But the question remains
column22: will there be a new board member? Could this whole thing be a scheme from Musk himself to make it appear as though an investor wants some more independent representation on the board only to have an announcement all lined up? That would be very unlike Musk
column23: or would it?Tsunami of HurtI have a history with this stock I first recommended it to investors of Zacks Home Run Investor back in 2013 when it was trading around $38. I talked about thestock in a videoshortly before it was added to the service. The concept was that there was going to be a huge increase in reported revenue and investors were about to see some ""sticker shock"" albeit
column24: the good kind.Not long before that video was shot
column25: Elon Musk warned investors that ""tsunami of hurt"" was in store for those who were short and believe me
column26: there were plenty of them. One year after that warning shares were up more than 400%.Doomed To Repeat ItBob Lutz said that those that those who don't learn from history are doomed to repeat it. Well at least I think he did. OK
column27: let's put it this way
column28: it is a common saying and Bob probably said it at one point. What he did say on CNBC on 4/12/17 was that TSLA was ""doomed.""So let me lay it out for Bob and some other bears. A new model
column29: that when made available for pre order saw more than 100K in the first 48 hours
column30: is going to be delivered this year. About a year ago Musk noted that there are over 400K orders.The demand is real and we could get more color on that in the next earnings release.There could be another ""series"" of announcements from Musk who has been called a ""Svengali of the stock market."" The shorts are feeling the pain
column31: but seemingly continue to reload as their thesis of a crazy valuation continues to carry the day.Right now the stock is around $300 - but if Musk's warnings are anything like before
column32: a run to $450 and beyond could only be the beginning.Don't Forget to Watch This Video from Dave   Bartosiak: Tesla Success Hinges On Model 3Looking for Ideas with Even Greater Upside?Most of Zacks' investment ideas are short-term

column1: Tesla (TSLA) Stock Slumps as Investors Question Musk's Ties to Board;4/12/2017;"Shares of Tesla Motors Corp.TSLAclosed more than 3.8% lower on Wednesday after a group of investors urged the company to add new independent directors to its board that do not have any prior ties to Elon Musk.In aletterpenned by representatives from several major Tesla investor groups
column2: the corporate governance of the Silicon Valley-based electric carmaker was called into question.""We expect that as companies make the transition to publicly traded status
column3: the governance structures and practices in place at the time of the IPO will evolve to align with the company's changing strategy
column4: the note said. ""However
column5: Tesla's seven-member board is largely unchanged from its pre-IPO days. In fact
column6: only one of the current directors has been appointed since the IPO in 2010.""The group suggested that the board appoint two new directors that have no prior ""personal or professional relationships"" with Elon Musk
column7: and it also called on the directors to hold staggered annual elections for the board.As mentioned in the letter
column8: several of Tesla's directors were brought on board many years ago and have previously worked with Musk in some way.For example
column9: Tesla's board currently includes Elon's brother Kimbal Musk
column10: as well as Brad Buss
column11: the former chief financial officer of SolarCity. Elon Musk served on the SolarCity board for several years before Tesla purchased the solar energy company last year.Elon Musk
column12: never afraid to stick up for his company
column13: took to Twitter to not only defend Tesla
column14: but also promise that new members of the board were coming:@ReutersThis investor group should buy Ford stock. Their governance is amazing ...- Elon Musk (@elonmusk)April 12
column15: 2017@ReutersBesides
column16: I already said we'd add more independent members during SCTY merger. Will announce soon
column17: but this group has nothing to do with it.- Elon Musk (@elonmusk)April 12
column18: 2017News of the letter
column19: which was dated on Monday
column20: broke the same day of the release of a new study suggesting that Tesla's Model S is one of the hottest used cars on the pre-owned market.According to Autolist.com'sdata
column21: used Model S cars tend to sell about 5% faster than their peer group average. The study also described the Model S as being in ""a league of its own"" for sale prices compared to listing price expectations. In short
column22: used Model S vehicles are selling quicker
column23: and for more money
column24: than their industry rivals.And it's exactly these types of results that keep many investors confident in the leadership of Elon Musk. Tesla has shown remarkable growth over the past several years
column25: and the company consistently delivers quality cars.Sure
column26: there are still plenty of question marks surrounding the carmaker's debt load
column27: but I'm not sure it is time to start turning on Musk quite yet.Looking for Ideas with Even Greater Upside?Most of Zacks' investment ideas are short-term

column1: Why My Son Just Had to Buy Tesla Stock;4/12/2017;"I started investing with my two boys when they were just five-   and seven-years-old. This gave them about a 30 year advantage   over their dad of buying their first stock. Along the way
column2: we've   learned some lessons of long-term investing and seen some pretty   great returns as well.Tesla(NASDAQ: TSLA) was one of the stocks that my kids bought before I   owned any shares of the electric vehicle maker. They thought the   technology was cool
column3: Elon Musk was as talented as Iron Man
column4: and   they kept seeing more and more Tesla's on the road.Let's look at their investing thesis and how it's played   out.""Dad
column5: Tesla cars are really cool.""Tesla is a tech company that just happens to make cars. The   company's ability to innovate has propelled its popularity and   fueled demand of its vehicles. My boys have had some kind of   electronic device in their hands since before they could read
column6: so   having a car that's described as anapp on four wheelswas a technology they embraced without question.The ability forover-the-air updateswas a revolutionary step forward in the auto industry. It has   allowed the company to provide customers new features
column7: after   they've brought their car home
column8: avoiding expensive recalls.makeArticleAd();Image source: Tesla.comMy kids love the fact Tesla cars don't use gas
column9: they make no   noise
column10: have two trunks
column11: have a huge display for navigation and   feature settings
column12: and areridiculously fast. Furthermore
column13: Tesla has been constantlyupgradingits cars more like a software company than a car company
column14: making   it even harder for the incumbent competitors to catch up.Recently
column15: Elon Musk
column16: Tesla's CEO
column17: has said the company ""will   never stop innovating
column18: and will providemajor upgradesevery 12 to 18 months. Tesla's proven track record of innovation   by itself is a great reason to invest in this company
column19: but   there's more to like about Tesla.""Dad
column20: Elon Musk is the real-life Tony Stark.""It's true. Tony Stark
column21: the fictitious eccentric billionaire
column22: CEO
column23: and Iron Man inventor wasmodeled after Elon Musk. Looking at Musk's resume
column24: it's no surprise that my boys think   of Tesla's CEO as Tony Stark.Founded Zip2
column25: sold to CompaqCo-founded x.com
column26: became Paypal
column27: sold to EbayFounded SpaceXBailed out Tesla
column28: became CEOHelped start Solarcity
column29: became ChairmanElon Musk is a visionary leader
column30: inspiring others to achieve   the unimaginable. In the early days of Tesla
column31: Elon Musk published   a not-so-secretmaster plan
column32: and with the launch of the Tesla Model 3 the company will have   accomplished those amazing goals in a little more than a decade.   Once that checklist was close to complete
column33: Musk published hismaster plan part duex
column34: which includes innovations such as integrated   solar-roof-with-battery
column35: self-driving cars
column36: and a ride hailing   service to allow Tesla owners to make money with their vehicle   when they are not using it.While being visionary makes for great headlines
column37: it's nothing   without being able to bring the ideas to reality. Elon Musk does   this with his own confident style
column38: whilelaughingat the competition. The Teslacharging networkand thegigafactoryare two examples of never-before-accomplished feats.""Dad
column39: there'sanotherTesla""Tesla's constantly improving itsproduct performanceand its ever growingcharging network. The company'saward winningcars drive increasing demand for its innovative products. The   Tesla brand and its cars are becoming so popular that the   not-yet-released model 3 has a waiting list of373
column40: 000 customersthat put down $1
column41: 000 to reserve a car they've never driven.Recently the companydoubled downon its efforts to ramp manufacturing capacity to deliver 500
column42: 000   vehicles per year by 2018. In the most recent quarter
column43: the   company made another step in that progression and delivered arecord numberof cars.While Tesla is growing fast
column44: it's important to put this in   perspective in terms of the company's valuation. Currently   Tesla's market capitalization is $49 billion
column45: $5 billion more   thanFord
column46: but Ford sold over 87 times more cars than Tesla in   2016
column47: and the electric-car-solar-panel-installation company   is still not consistently profitable. Tesla bears would point out   that the model Sgrowth is slowing
column48: the company's infrastructure growth will require additionalcapital
column49: the SolarCity acquisition could be adrag on the bottom line
column50: and often Teslafails to meet delivery expectations.""I don't care what you say Dad
column51: I'm buyingTesla stock""My kids first invested in Tesla in 2013 when the stock was   under $100. At the time
column52: I thought Tesla was overpriced
column53: and I   wasn't theonly one. When the kids' next chance to buy stocks came around in 2014
column54: the stock had risen to over $200. In the meantime
column55: my older son   had the opportunity to drive a Model S and was blown away
column56: which   is why he was so adamant about buying more shares. Both purchases   have beaten the market
column57: and the 2013 buy has more than tripled   the market returns

column1: General Electric Company (GE) Needs to Boot Jeff Immelt;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsDespite having once served on an economic board for President Obama
column3: General Electric Company(NYSE:GE) CEO Jeff Immelt is a lifelong Republican. GE stockshouldbe the perfect stock for the Trump era. It is a U.S.-centric industrial manufacturer employing thousands of American workers for good wages.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)With its deal to combine its oilfield operations with those ofBaker Hughes Incorporated(NYSE:BHI)
column4: it's even big in the oilpatch.However
column5: GE stock under Immelt is no place to invest if you want to get rich. Since the bottom of the post-crash market in 2009
column6: GE's performance has barely kept pace with that of theS&P 500. Over the last year
column7: while the average S&P stock is up 15%
column8: GE is down by 2%.The best reason to buy the stock is the dividend
column9: 24 cents per share
column10: a yield of 3.2%. Most years
column11: like last year
column12: it can cover that dividend with earnings.Promises
column13: PromisesImmelt is a veteran politician who has been looking to the future for years without delivering one.Smart money is no longer listening.  Yet Immelt will go down in business history as a great salesman
column14: because like an errant husband
column15: each promise seems to land on someone who wants to believe it.10 Hopeless Stocks to Wash From Your Portfolio ForeverBut the goals Immelt has trouble meeting are modest. For its first quarter
column16: which GE will report on April 21
column17: analysts are only expecting earnings of 17 cents per share on revenues of $26.36 billion. That is less than half what it earned in the December quarter
column18: on a quarter less revenue.Immelt also keeps moving pieces around his board. Most recently he talked about selling the company's light bulb business
column19: following similar moves bySiemens AG (ADR)(OTCMKTS:SIEGY) andKoninklijke Philips NV (ADR)(NYSE:PHG)
column20: which figured out years ago that people don't replace long-lasting LED bulbs once they are installed.How much will General Electric book by making this great move? About $500 million. On a market cap of almost $262 billion
column21: that's pocket change.Yet you're always going to find people pounding the table for GE stock
column22: claiming Immelt still has aces up his sleeve. Oil is up
column23: and so the Baker Hughes bet will pay off big. Besides
column24: Immelt might leave after the Baker Hughes deal is done. That will certainly be a catalyst for higher prices.Immelt's exit may be the stock's only hope. Everything he touches turns into tin
column25: and what he lets go turns at least into silver.TakeSynchrony Financial(NYSE:SYF)
column26: the credit card unit spun out to shareholders in 2014. Since then
column27: Synchrony is up 43% and GE 13.5%.If you think that sounds good for GE
column28: the S&P 500 is up almost 19% since then.Time to Get Out of GE StockI finally got out of General Electric in January for $31.41 per share. GE opened for trade April 12 at just a hair under $30.Will This Catalyst Put Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock On Steroids?Yet the average rating for GE is still overweight. Half the analysts who follow the stock have it on their buy lists
column29: against just one with the courage to say sell.GE is a big company. It will continue to make big sales. It will keep buying other companies at the margins of its current operations and some of its options will keep looking interesting.But it is time to put a period on the Immelt era. The high-flying entertainment and finance company of Jack Welch has been reduced to a helpless industrial giant
column30: a widows-and-orphans stock that barely manages to earn enough to pay those dividends.This will remain the case until Jeff Immelt is in GE's rear-view mirror. When he is gone I might be interested in GE stock
column31: butonlywhen he is gone.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column32: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing
column33: he did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.The postGeneral Electric Company (GE) Needs to Boot Jeff Immeltappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Ride Tesla To $450 And Beyond!;4/12/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();I am calling forTesla(TSLA) to reach $450 within a year from now.  That is not a typo
column2: it is fully $125 ahead of the highest price target on the street.  Dougherty's Charlie Anderson put a price target of $375 on the stock back on 2/23/17 when he reiterated his buy rating.My call for such a big move in the stock comes from a solid foundation.  The most important part of the foundation is the reason investors put their money into a stock - they expect the value of the company to rise.There are dozens upon dozens of ways to value a company.  When you boil it down there are two basic methods growth or value.  If you are a value investor you can probably stop right here as you focus on the past performance and want to see some sort of ""distress"" from which an investment can come back from.On the other hand
column3: if you are a growth investor
column4: then I have something that will help your case.  The best type of growth is sequential
column5: and that is just what we expect to see from TSLA over the next year:Follow Brian Bolan on Twitter @BBolan1Is That Growth Enough?Lately we have seen a few analysts talk about TSLA and do so in some rather strange terms.  Last week we had the Barclays analyst who has been bearish on the stock for year reiterate a sell rating and a $165 price target.  The report talked about a red pill / blue pill scenario in which you either except the idea of ""valuations"" or you live in a world where infinite growth is possible.  The analyst noted that ""we don't think 1Q EPS will matter
column6: and while Model 3 hype is baked in
column7: it could drive another leg up.""When you have one of the most bearish analysts in the name suggesting another leg up will come with earnings you have to wonder how much more the bears can withstand.  The answer is a lot.Short InterestTSLA has a lot of ""naysayers"" and it is not something new.  I was looking at the short interest as reported on the NASDAQ site and then compared it to the stock price.  I charted the shares sold short and the price of TSLA at the close on the corresponding day.This chart shows me a rather important part of why I think TSLA goes to $450 and beyond.  As the share price moved higher from November 1 through the end of January the shorts were hammered
column8: but they added to their positions.The first meaningful decrease in the short position happened in mid February. It took the 1Q delivery numbers for TSLA to send the stock over $300 per share
column9: but if you have been looking at social media at all
column10: you have to get the feeling that the shorts are now pressing their bets.ValuationsThe main talking point that the shorts stick to is the valuation of the company.  Let's just address that one head on to see what they are talking about.  I will start with the standard metrics:No earnings for TSLA means that we can't really value them on trailing or forward multiple.  GM and F both have some paltry numbers in terms of earnings multiples especially when looking at the industry average.But the market is kind of funny when it comes to how it looks at growth.  It really likes company's that grow revenue and earnings.  Let's take a look at another chart and then think a bit more about why the valuations are what they are.Seems that this year is going to be pretty good for TSLA and the other two well not so much.  Next year looks like earnings will take a big step forward for TSLA while there is going to be a broader move higher according the analyst reports.Recent Attack On The BoardI giggled a little when I saw a recent article that talked about how investors want more board members with fewer ties to Elon Musk.  I know it is not everyday that the CEO has his brother on the board
column11: so I get that argument
column12: but it really starts and stops there.Whenever there is talk about increased corporate governance
column13: we always hear about the steps that Cal (PERS) and Cal State Teachers Retirement System (STRS) are taking.  Yes
column14: these are big investment funds and you would think they would be looking to support the companies in their own back yard - but you would be wrong.  Like any investor
column15: they don't care too much about the location of a company
column16: they care about the returns they get from it.  Yet
column17: those names popped up in recent discussion.I took at look to see where this big time investors ranked in terms of TSLA shareholders.  I scrolled through 3 screens find Cal PERS which owned 308K (a decrease of 8.6K shares from the last report) shares and STRS which had 259K shares ( a nearly 7K decrease from the last report).Seems they have a very small position to get this much press about the board.  Their position seems tiny compared to that of Fidelity at 22M shares or T Rowe Price at 11M shares or even the recent investment by Tencent of 8M shares.The Board is Elon Musk and for good reason.  He is the biggest shareholder and get this
column18: he is buying not selling!According to Finviz
column19: Musk holds about 33.6M shares
column20: making him the single largest shareholder by a wide margin.  Musk recently added to his position in a secondary offering
column21: buying $25M worth of stock at $262.I searched around several sites
column22: and found that few accounted for Musk's huge position.  This site show that insiders own less that 1% which makes you wonder if we have to fact check everything for ourselves.But the question remains
column23: will there be a new board member?  Could this whole thing be a scheme from Musk himself to make it appear as though an investor wants some more independent representation on the board only to have an announcement all lined up?  That would be very unlike Musk
column24: or would it?Tsunami of HurtI have a history with this stock I first recommended it to investors of Zacks Home Run Investor back in 2013 when it was trading around $38.  I talked about thestock in a videoshortly before it was added to the service. The concept was that there was going to be a huge increase in reported revenue and investors were about to see some ""sticker shock"" albeit
column25: the good kind.Not long before that video was shot
column26: Elon Musk warned investors that ""tsunami of hurt"" was in store for those who were short and believe me
column27: there were plenty of them.  One year after that warning shares were up more than 400%.More recently there was another warning.  Make that two warnings.  First was the April 3 tweet of  ""Stormy weather in Shortville "" and then a direct response shown here:I mention this because after that first report with big sales numbers there was a series of announcements that lifted the stock from $40 to $90 then to $120 and before long we were testing $200 at $190 a share before a pull back sent prices back below $130.  This would be that last time the stock traded below $130.Doomed To Repeat ItBob Lutz said that those that those who don't learn from history are doomed to repeat it.  Well at least I think he did.  OK
column28: let's put it this way
column29: it is a common saying and Bob probably said it at one point.  What he did say on CNBC on 4/12/17 was that TSLA was ""doomed.""So let me lay it out for Bob and some other bears.  A new model
column30: that when made available for pre order saw more than 100K in the first 48 hours
column31: is going to be delivered this year.  About a year ago Musk noted that there are over 400K orders.The demand is real and we could get more color on that in the next earnings release.There could be another ""series"" of announcements from Musk who has been called a ""Svengali of the stock market."" The shorts are feeling the pain
column32: but seemingly continue to reload as their thesis of a crazy valuation continues to carry the day.Right now the stock is around $300 - but if Musk's warnings are anything like before
column33: a run to $450 and beyond could only be the beginning.Don't Forget to Watch This Video from Dave Bartosiak: Tesla Success Hinges On Model 3Looking for Ideas with Even Greater Upside?Most of Zacks' investment ideas are short-term

column35: I invite you to consider our long-term opportunities. These rare trades look to start fast with strong Zacks Ranks
column36: but carry through with double and triple-digit profit potential. Starting now

column32: both near-term and long-term
column33: are real.10 Blue-Chip Stocks That Will Bleed for the Rest of 2017But Q1 earnings could be a catalyst
column34: given cooperation from the equity markets and low Q4 delinquency rates. Recent economic data supports additional rate hikes this year
column35: with BofA saying each 25 basis point increase adds 5 cents in EPS. That means earnings should strengthen as the year goes on - and Bank of America stock should follow.With the stock pricing in basically zero growth
column36: expectations still are modest
column37: even with the stock still up nearly 40% from pre-election levels. I don't know that I'd expect another 40% by year-end
column38: but there's certainly a good chance that BAC stock can challenge $26 again
column39: at least.The author has no positions in any securities mentioned
column40: but may take a position in BAC stock this week.More From InvestorPlaceUnited States Steel Corporation (X) Stock Sinks on Ore

column1: This Is The Future Of Energy. Heres How To Invest;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsRecently my team and I have been telling my readers about a quiet revolution that's taking place thanks to eccentric billionaire Elon Musk and his band of scientists atTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA).makeArticleAd();You see
column3: for years they've been working feverishly at their lab in Fremont
column4: California on a battery that could provide enough energy to power a house.Last year
column5: news came along that they'd finally broken through.And now
column6: for the first time in decades
column7: we could see the entire utility sector turned on its head as a result - leading to massive gains for early investors.As you can see
column8: Tesla's battery storage device looks nothing like your old-fashioned AA battery.It's a sleek
column9: compact unit that you can mount on the wall in your garage. One single
column10: stand-alone unit delivers enough power to take an entire home completely off the grid. Simply charge it with a solar panel
column11: windmill or any other power source
column12: and you've got all the energy you need.Thanks to Tesla
column13: the world is about to see that an energy sea-change has been quietly unfolding before their eyes for several years now.And many of the world's greatest investors are quickly staking their claims in this new technology.Billionaire venture capitalist Peter Thiel - the first outside investor inFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB)- has poured in millions of dollars of his own money. (As one of the early supporters of Donald Trump's presidential run
column14: it's rumored Thiel has the President Trump's ear
column15: too.)Bill Gates has made not one
column16: but three big investments. And Warren Buffett'sBerkshire Hathaway Inc.(NYSE:BRK.A
column17: BRK.B) has jumped in as well.But it's not just the brilliance of this energy storage device that makes it an appealing investment space.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017: Still the Best?It's the timing.You see
column18: this device is going to enter the market at a time when demand for a product like this has never been higher.In fact
column19: there are three intriguing factors making this technology particularly promising1. U.S. Political SupportBecause of geo-politics and concerns about pollution
column20: governments are falling over themselves to get more energy storage systems in place.Take California
column21: for instance. That one single state could cause every public company in the energy storage industry to soar triple-digits
column22: thanks to new legislation
column23: mandating that its largest utilities have enough energy storage capacity to provide electrical support for 1 million homes.That's the equivalent of building a dam's worth of infrastructure. And they want it in place by 2020.Keep in mind: when the governments mandate something
column24: it isn't simply a request. It's the law. If utilities don't comply
column25: they'll be punished. That's why California's largest utilities - from Con Edison to Pacific Gas and Electric - are already jumping on this.Massachusetts is following California's lead. It just launched a $10 million initiative and aims to be a national leader in energy storage.And New York
column26: Texas
column27: Oregon
column28: Arizona and other states are making similar moves.2. Global Political SupportGermany is dedicating $56 million a year specifically for energy storage. Japan is setting aside $700 million
column29: aiming to be the ""world leader"" in energy storage. And China is jumping in with both feet. Its energy storage market is projected to quadruple over the next decade.The driving factor behind this global push for energy storage is simple. Reducing pollution.""If China doubles its energy production over the next two decades
column30: billionaire Peter Thiel points out
column31: ""it will also double its air pollution. If every one of India's hundreds of millions of households were to live the way Americans already do - using only today's tools - the result would be environmentally catastrophic. Spreading old ways to create wealth around the world will result in devastation
column32: not riches.""In fact
column33: the International Energy Agency has called on world leaders to spend a combined $380 billion on energy storage by 2050.3. Public SupportBut political support is only half the story. The energy storage revolution is really being driven by the public at large
column34: and it all funnels down to one thing.Freedom.For some people
column35: it's freedom from utility companies. They don't like the fact that utilities are essentially a monopoly and can raise their rates at a whim. With an energy storage system
column36: you wouldn't have to worry about this.Others want to ""get out from under big brother
column37: as one energy storage user told USA Today.He and others like him don't trust that the government won't try to control their energy consumption simply because they're running their A/C longer than a bureaucrat deems proper.Bottom line:The energy revolution is coming. And Tesla's battery storage device is just part of the story.10 Under-the-Radar Stocks to Buy Now for Explosive UpsideNow here's the thing I'm not recommending you invest in Tesla. I've identifiedthree little-known stocksthat could soar 10 times higher by 2020 - and they'll do it by riding Tesla's coattails.Sure
column38: Tesla is likely to see some nice long-term gains thanks to this revolution. But the lion's share of the gains will be found in smaller
column39: lesser-known companies that are making this technology a reality.Make no mistake: Opportunities like this don't come around very often. And when the public catches on to this revolution
column40: the big gains will have already been made.You can click here to view my full report.StreetAuthority's mission is to help individual investors earn above-average profits by providing a source of independent
column41: unbiased - and most of all
column42: profitable - investing ideas. Unlike traditional publishers
column43: StreetAuthority doesn't simply regurgitate the latest stock market news. Instead
column44: we provide in-depth research
column45: plus specific investment ideas and immediate action to take based on the latest market events. Visit us atStreetAuthority.com.More From InvestorPlace10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-Hot10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double This Quarter7 Dividend Stocks With Yields That Grow Like WeedsThe postThis Is The Future Of Energy. Here's How To Investappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Chesapeake Energy Corporation (CHK) Stock Is Still a HUGE Risk at $6;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsInvestors who bought intoChesapeake Energy Corporation(NYSE:CHK) a year ago are sitting on a whopping 37.3% return. Heck
column3: if you bought CHK stock at the beginning of 2016
column4: you made 56% on the year
column5: more than four times theS&P 500.makeArticleAd();Source:Philadelphia 76ers Via FlickrCHK stock hasn't traded below $5 on a consistent basis since July 2016. Suddenly
column6: it has become the poster child for low volatility. Trading as high as $30 less than three years ago
column7: Chesapeake Energy longs probably feel a bottom is in - and who could blame them?CHK stock appears ready to crack double digits once energy prices push higher or other good news appears as a catalyst to get it moving.InvestorPlacecontributor Vince Martin feels an improving economy should help with that.""The economy is improving
column8: which generally drives energy prices higher
column9: Martin recently wrote. ""President Trump's expressed desire for higher coal production should have less practical impact than he expects
column10: as utilities already have switched to natural gas - and aren't switching back. I don't know that I expect $70 oil and $4 natural gas again - but there is room for higher energy prices in the current economic climate.""10 Blue-Chip Stocks That Will Bleed for the Rest of 2017It's hard to argue with economics or Martin's assessment.So CHK Stock Is a Winner?There's a caveat.Rising energy prices float all boats; investors still need to evaluate the risk of buying CHK stock (instead of buying another oil and gas stock) and its$9.9 billionin long-term debt. Anytime a company's outstanding loans are greater than its market cap
column11: you're most certainly playing with fire.Having said all this
column12: let me just say that I'm by no means an expert when it comes to oil and gas stocks. I did
column13: however
column14: warn investorsback in 2011 when CHK stock was trading above $30 that it was going nowhere fast and to steer clear of it. Of course
column15: in hindsight
column16: we know what happened.The one thing I've learned from all my years writing about stocks is that you get pretty good at knowing your strengths - and weaknesses. For me
column17: energy stocks are my kryptonite. Just reading the word BBOe gets me tied up in knots.I'm sure some investors have figured out down to the penny how much Chesapeake Energy's 1.7 billion barrels of oil equivalent are worth. Maybe $40
column20: all the way up to $100 per barrel - and I'm sure their calculation suggests CHK stock's intrinsic value is worth far more than $6 per share.Good on them.For the rest of us left to our own devices it's important that we carefully evaluate the risk of buying CHK stock
column21: given that it could still go bankrupt.If you believe that energy prices will rise from their current levels around $53 to
column22: say
column24: a lot of businesses will benefit from this increase
column25: not just Chesapeake Energy. And the other side of this argument is  what if oil pricesdon'trise?Goldman Sachs Group Inc(NYSE:GS)sees oil pricesstabilizing over the long term
column26: settling in the mid-$50s.Either way
column27: why wouldn't you just buy an oil-related exchange-traded fund to minimize your risk that CHK isn't the one?Chesapeake Energy's Financial SituationNow
column28: let's get back to Chesapeake Energy potentially going bankrupt.GuruFocus.com says Chesapeake Energy's Altman Z-Score is currently -2.25. Anything less than 1.81 suggests a company faces the real possibility of bankruptcy within the next two years. Of course
column29: that can change dramatically by making money. Analysts estimate that CHK will make 74 cents and $1.18 in fiscal 2017 and 2018 respectively.I did a quick Altman Z-Score calculation of my own which appears below.Current Altman Z-Score CalculationCHKWorking Capital-1
column32: 000 Total Assets 13
column35: 000 Retained Earnings -17
column38: 000 EBITDA -3
column41: 000 Market Cap 5
column44: 000 Total Liabilities 14
column47: 000 Net Sales 7
column50: 000-1.97Source: Morningstar.com FinancialsI get -1.97 which is slightly better than GuruFocus.com. If you make the EBITDA loss of $3.06 billion
column51: positive
column52: the Altman Z-Score becomes -0.42
column53: still in bankruptcy territory but clearly much better. The improved earnings situation would then increase the value of its assets
column54: which would push the number closer to positive territory.So
column55: yes
column56: it's very possible that two years of increased earnings will significantly reduce the risk of bankruptcy.3 Reasons Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is Still a Top BuyMy brand of investing is simple. Follow Warren Buffett's lead. Rule No. 1: Never lose money. Rule No. 2: Never forget rule No. 1.Back in 2011
column57: I suggestedEOG Resources Inc(NYSE:EOG) provided less risk to investors than CHK. Clearly
column58: that hasn't changed.At $6
column59: CHK stock is still a huge risk.As of this writing
column60: Will Ashworth did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceWill This Catalyst Put Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock On Steroids?The 11 Best Dividend Stocks to BuyThe 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017: Still the Best?The postChesapeake Energy Corporation (CHK) Stock Is Still a HUGE Risk at $6appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: How to Wrangle Advanced Micro Devices
column2: Inc. (AMD) Stock for Profits;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIs recent stock weakness inAdvanced Micro Devices
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMD) offering investors an early warning to make an exit? Or is this a bullish opportunity to buy? Today
column5: we'll look at the current setup in AMD stock
column6: then present a strategy that will provide profits without piling on the risk.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockIt has been just more than a month since I last penned amostly optimistic take and strategy on AMD. Shares of Advanced Micro are mostly unchanged for the period
column7: but beneath the surface
column8: there has been a good deal of price volatility to ponder.The most striking catalyst during this period was a surprising initiation from Goldman Sachs. Last week
column9: the firm slapped AMD stockwith a ""sell"" rating and $11 price targetroughly 20% below the prior night's close. The bearish coverage was good enough to send shares more than 6% lower in a single session.Analyst Toshiya Hari did note many improvements at AMD under the stewardship of CEO Lisa Su. In his view
column10: product launches
column11: cost management and deleveraging of the company's balance sheet have all been well-executed. However
column12: given 2016's substantial 300%-plus gain and relatively steep multiple
column13: Hari warned strongly that Advanced Micro Devices was also ""priced for perfection.""Also
column14: analysts expect that an unfavorable price war with bothIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) andNvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) would occur at Advanced Micro's expense.The 11 Best Dividend Stocks to BuyIs it time to listen to Goldman? One could use it as a starting point. However
column15: Goldman's calls - beyond their short-term influence - aren't exactly the gold standard. I'd prefer to look at what others have to say and maintain an open mind.AMD Stock ChartClick to EnlargeAdvanced Micro Devices is far from a momentum play right now - at least in the bullish direction. Stochastics are oversold
column16: and an uptrend line of around six months in duration has been broken.Shares could always snap back aggressively with a bullish earnings reaction. But for now
column17: Goldman's knockdown of AMD stock essentially pulled the rug out from what had been a nicely-developing momentum situation.Maybe Goldman is
column18: as alum and CNBC personality James Cramer suggests
column19: merely""taking away the punchbowl""for AMD - but a company that remains on track to grow its business and capture market share?AMD's chart does more accurately reflect a punchbowl situation. And there's nothing wrong with embracing this type of more technically driven entry into shares.Just don't play Advanced Micro Devices too loosely.How to Trade AMD StockI think Advanced Micro is a buy amid a short-lived corrective move
column20: but I want to better control risk than just a simple stop-loss methodology.Right now
column21: I suggest theMay $15 call/$12 put collar. With shares at $13
column22: the package is priced for $13.20. For the 20-cent cost or additional premium paid over simply owning shares
column23: the investor is fully protected below $12.BlackBerry Ltd (BBRY) Stock Jumps 18% on License Win Against QualcommTechnically speaking
column24: the collar's insurance makes sense. A low of $12.38 back in early March does appear to be significant in maintaining
column25: while still allowing for a smidgeon of wiggle room down to the $12 put.AMD's next earnings report is scheduled for May 1. In our view
column26: the real cost of this collar is the earnings report
column27: or maybe a product update. Then
column28: there's a significant shift of bullish momentum in shares. Remember
column29: the $15 call is being sold to finance the protective put. So without any adjustments
column30: the call sale does initially cap upside at 12%.Investment accounts under Christopher Tyler's management do not currently own positions in any of the securities or their derivatives mentioned in this article. column1: Facebook Inc (FB): Its Not Too Late to Buy FB Stock;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI confess thatFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) never appealed to me as an investment. I avoid momentum stocks anyway
column3: and I didn't really believe that meaningful revenue would be generated by Mark Zuckerberg & Co. I was dead wrong.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockFacebook has become a digital billboard
column4: generating a massive 98% of its revenue from ads
column5: which can be a terrific business. Now
column6: more than 5 million businesses advertise on Facebook.com.As technology improved and the ability to ascertain return on investment became more and more efficient
column7: finding which sources for eyeballs would pay the best became easier. I never thought FB stock would be such a place
column8: but here we are.Not only that
column9: but FB has gotten even better at figuring out how to leverage its users into generating more revenue
column10: and a lot of that is happening via mobile. It makes sense
column11: of course
column12: because the entire world is mobile at this point and emerging markets are moving out of 2G into higher speeds.Thus
column13: FB stock has soared because it really owns the display side of generating digital ad revenue
column14: whileAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column15: NASDAQ:GOOGL) owns the search side of the business.10 Blue-Chip Stocks That Will Bleed for the Rest of 2017I'm going to do some number-crunching here. I don't want to overwhelm
column16: but you'll see how FB stock price is going up on the backs of some impressive growth as shown in Q4:Daily Active Users (or DAUs): 1.23 billion
column17: geographically well-diversified with the U.S. & Canada at 15%
column18: Europe at 21%
column19: Asia-Pacific coming in at 32%
column20: and the rest of the globe also at 32%.Mobile DAUs: 1.15 billionMonthly Active Users (also known as MAUs): 1.86 billionMobile MAUs: 1.74 billionGrowth in ad revenue for Q4
column21: year-over-year was an astonishing 53% to $8.63 billion.Not only are users growing
column22: but the average revenue per monthly active user (or ARPU) is off the charts for North America
column23: climbing from $9 in Q4 of 2014 to $13.70 in 2015 (more than 50%!) and $19.81 last year
column24: up nearly 50%.Going back to this idea that mobile revenue growth is exploding on the backs of improving mobile technology
column25: mobile revenue in Q4 of 2014 was $2.5 billion. It nearly tripled to $7.2 billion last year.When you look at the entire digital ad spend these days
column26: it is dominated by Facebook and Google.I hate the idea that 98% of a company's revenues comes from one thing. Diversification means everything to me. However
column27: I cannot argue with the fact that FB is the 800-pound gorilla in the space.There are only three things that can upset the apple cart for FB stock
column28: and neither seem like they could ever be permanently damaging. First
column29: it is possible that something else appears that makes Facebook decline in popularity. This seems extremely unlikely at this point in time. Barring some kind of horrendous PR disaster that causes Facebook to implode
column30: I don't take this threat seriously.Second
column31: it is possible that the number of users is being misreported. How FB actually determines the number of users and how active they are is what matters here
column32: and if advertisers ever lose confidence in that data
column33: they could run for the hills. I'm not suggesting that this is the case
column34: but if it were
column35: then there would be trouble.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Won't Hit $1000 Like ThisFinally
column36: a severe recession could cripple advertising spending. The thing about this is that it would be temporary. The financial crisis took a toll on companies that relied on ad revenue
column37: but it came back. Facebook's balance sheet is a fortress
column38: so little would be impacted.FB stock trades at 40 times its earnings. And now
column39: I can't say it's unreasonable considering its growth rate.Lawrence Meyers is the CEO of PDL Capital
column40: and manager of the forthcomingLiberty Portfolio stock newsletter. As of this writing
column41: he has no position in any stock mentioned. He has 22 years' experience in the stock market
column42: and has written more than 1
column43: 600 articles on investing. Lawrence Meyers can be reached atTheLibertyPortfolio@gmail.com.More From InvestorPlace11 A-Plus Stocks That Are on Bernstein's 'Buy List'7 Tech Stocks That Are a Sneeze Away From CollapsingWill This Catalyst Put Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock On Steroids?The postFacebook Inc (FB): It's Not Too Late to Buy FB Stockappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 3 Reasons Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is Still a Top Buy;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News

column1: Will This Catalyst Put Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock On Steroids?;4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsUntil last year
column3: China had beenTesla Inc's(NASDAQ:TSLA) ""White Whale
column4: a coveted beast that had repeatedly eluded Elon Musk's otherwise fast-growing company.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBut sales in the world's most populous country tripled last year
column5: and could theoretically accelerate even more now that one of China's largest internet entities has bought a 5% stake in TSLA stock.Tencent Holdings Ltd(OTCMKTS:TCEHY) paid $1.78 billion for its relatively small stake (it's now the fifth-largest shareholder) in the luxury electric car maker.But the impact on Tesla
column6: and TSLA stock
column7: could be big.Tencent has enough clout to help move the needle for Tesla sales in China
column8: and the timing couldn't be better with Tesla set to launch the Model 3
column9: its first ""affordable"" electric car
column10: later this year.China Next Frontier for TSLA Stock GrowthLast year
column11: Tesla's China revenue topped $1 billion for the first time
column12: accounting for more than 15% of the company's total sales. That's good
column13: but there's plenty of room for improvement. Slow deliveries and a lack of charging stations contributed to a slow 2015 in China; sales fell by about a third that year. Sales bounced back emphatically last year
column14: in part because TSLA added 57 new stores worldwide and 200-plus new supercharger stations. But the Tencent deal should give Tesla a better understanding of the Chinese market
column15: which should help future growth.Investors clearly liked the move
column16: at least initially: Tesla stock jumped 2.7% the day the Tencent deal was announced. At $305 as of this writing
column17: TSLA is now up 43% year-to-date
column18: and a whopping 60% since the beginning of December. That kind of run from a company with a $48 billion market cap tends to bring naysayers out of the woodworks.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017: Still the Best?Sure enough
column19: Bob Lutz
column20: a formerFord Motor Company(NYSE:F) andGeneral Motors Company(NYSE:GM) executive
column21: said
column22: ""Raising capital is not going to help
column23: because fundamentally the business equation on electric cars is wrong. They cost more to build than what the public is willing to pay. That's the bottom line.""Sour grapes? Perhaps. It's no secret that traditional automakers - and their executives - resent Tesla Motors' business model. And Ford
column24: one of Lutz's former companies
column25: just got passed by TSLA as the second-largest American automaker by market cap
column26: and GM is within spitting distance.But Lutz does have a point: Tesla isn't making money
column27: and hasn't for most of its relatively brief history. That hasn't stopped TSLA stock from rising nearly 810% in the last five years
column28: just like a lack of profits didn't much hurtAmazon.com
column29: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) stock in its nascent stages.Tencent Deal Keeps Tesla Stock FreshAnd yes
column30: Tesla is still very much a young buck
column31: especially as a public company
column32: having debuted on theNasdaqin June 2010. It's still working out some kinks
column33: particularly overseas. But its potential in places like China and India
column34: each of which have four times as many drivers as America
column35: is immense.Why Amazon.com
column36: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Still Has Countless CatalystsAfter a much better year in China
column37: the Tencent deal should help improve its expanding Chinese footprint. And if nothing else
column38: it looks good to investors when one of the richest companies in the world wants to be in business with you.Tesla Motors may not be rich itself - yet - but TSLA stock is still fresh and hip in the eyes of most investors
column39: something companies likeApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) would kill to get back right about now. Things like the Tencent deal and Model 3 release should keep Tesla stock feeling fresh for quite some time.I say buy now while it's still ripe.As of this writing

column1: Do Millennials Care About Stocks?;4/12/2017;"Welcome to Episode #77 of the Zacks Market Edge Podcast.Every week
column2: host and Zacks stock strategist
column3: Tracey Ryniec
column4: will be joined by guests to discuss the hottest investing topics in stocks
column5: bonds and ETFs and how it impacts your life.In this episode
column6: Tracey is joined by Ryan McQueeney
column7: a Zacks Editor and also co-host of the weekly Friday Finish Line podcast with Maddy Johnson
column8: and Parth Panchal
column9: a Zacks intern and finance major at Loyola of Chicago
column10: to discuss Millennials and investing.There's a myth that Millennials are all broke
column11: living in their parents' basements
column12: and have so much college debt it prohibits them from doing things
column13: like investing some spare cash in the stock market.But a host of apps like Robinhood
column14: which makes it nearly free for Millennials to trade
column15: appear to be changing that.Do Millennials Care About Stocks?Tracey asked Ryan and Parth
column16: two Millennials who
column17: yes
column18: also have an interest in finance so they are slightly biased
column19: just what they and their friends invest in.Yes
column20: they are buying stocks. Yes
column21: even the history major
column22: non-finance Millennials are interested. No
column23: they're not buying ETFs.They like stocks that are highly volatile and have room to the upside such as the social media stocks or the biotechs.They also invest in what they know.As Parth said
column24: ""Millennials like to have something in their hands"" so that means when they invest
column25: they like to know
column26: and most likely
column27: love
column28: the company they are buying. They are emotional investors.It's not surprising
column29: then
column30: that companies that feature prominently in Millennials lives are also among the more popular stocks.What Are Millennials Buying?1.       The Snapchat IPO (SNAP) was big among the younger Millennials. They are the original users of the product so they know it inside and out.2.       Facebook (FB) skews older but Millennials grew up using it. They cannot imagine a world without it so they also like the stock.3.       Tesla (TSLA) is another popular stock
column31: not because they can afford to buy one of the cars
column32: but because they like to think they can in the future. They like to buy stock in companies they believe in.4.       Alphabet (GOOGL) owns one of the most popular brands in the world
column33: YouTube
column34: but Millennial investors aren't really buying the stock. Why not? Tracey asked Parth and Ryan why Alphabet is left out in the cold.Where Do Millennials Get Their News?Millennials have short attention spans. They like to read headlines. But Millennial traders still need to get their financial news somewhere.Tracey was surprised to find out the top source of financial news for Millennials. You won't believe it either. Tune in!What other issues are on the minds of Millennials about stocks and investing?Find out the answer to this and more on this week's podcast.Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017makeArticleAd();In addition to the stocks discussed above

column2: Inc. Stock Is a Great Value Buy After Q1 Earnings (DAL);4/12/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsShares ofDelta Air Lines
column4: Inc.(NYSE:DAL) are on the rise Wednesday morning
column5: climbing about 3% on a first-quarter earnings report that topped the pros' expectations. It's not much
column6: but it's no surprise - DAL stock is habitually underappreciated
column7: but perhaps that won't last for much longer.makeArticleAd();The headline numbers: Revenues of $9.15 billion declined 1.1% year-over-year and just slightly missed analysts' estimates. However
column8: earnings came in at 77 cents per share
column9: which was 2 cents better than the consensus mark.Delta's operating income was not incredibly impressive. Adjusted pre-tax income for the quarter came in at $847 million
column10: down 45% year-over-year. DAL blamed higher fuel costs for the expense. Passenger unit revenues declined 0.5% on 0.5% lower capacity. An April storm will reduce the current quarter's pretax income by $125 million.They're good but not great earnings
column11: though little of that is on Delta's head. Going forward
column12: though
column13: investors would do well to consider buying into DAL stock
column14: as today's report might be the start of a much bigger run.It's Not What You Did
column15: But What You're DoingYou can wear your nice socks when reading Delta'searnings releasewithout worry that it will blow them off. The quarter was OK - nothing too great
column16: nothing too bad.The 11 Best Dividend Stocks to BuyBut considering that DAL stock trades at less than 8 times last year's earnings
column17: there's no real expectation for amazing growth.Delta's situationwillimprove
column18: though.Management noted that March was the first month it experienced positive passenger unit revenues since November 2015. Further
column19: they expect current-quarter passenger unit revenues to climb 1% to 3% and to remain positive throughout the year. That's good
column20: as are the comments from CFO Paul Jacobson regarding fuel costs:""We expect the entirety of our 2017 margin pressure to have occurred in the March quarter from higher fuel prices.""Speaking of margins
column21: DAL's operating margins for the latest quarter came in at 11.5%. Again
column22: nothing to write home about. But for the current quarter
column23: Delta Air Lines expects operating margins of 17% to 19%. That's a substantial amount of improvement.Delta's StrengthsNow that earnings are out
column24: what should investors do with DAL stock? Well
column25: despite some ""meh"" to Delta's quarter
column26: the stock actually looks pretty good.First
column27: let's consider capital return. Delta shares yield 1.8% in dividends at current prices - not really enough to warrant a spot on our11 best dividend stocks list
column28: but it is a decent payout.Second
column29: Delta bought back $200 million worth of stock last quarter. This is down from the $775 million it bought back in the same period a year ago (although $350 million was accelerated for anti-dilution due to pension obligations). But the point is the same: DAL is in there buying back its stock.When a stock trades at less than 8 times earnings
column30: buybacks are meaningful.It also helps that Warren Buffett is in there. Buffett'sBerkshire Hathaway Inc.(NYSE:BRK.B) currently owns about 8% of DAL stock. A bear might argue that Buffett is almost finished buying
column31: since he's unlikely to acquire more than 10% of Delta. That's probably true. But between Buffett and Delta's buying - and almost more importantly
column32: not selling - there is a significant chunk of stock that won't hit the open market for quite some time.It also helps that DAL stock hasn't had a PR fiasco quite likeUnited Continental Holdings Inc(NYSE:UAL).What to Do With DAL StockThe valuation and Delta's price action play a big role here. DAL has been struggling
column33: off 8% on the year. But its ultra-low valuation makes it awfully enticing.3 Stocks to Watch on Wednesday: Tesla
column34: Inc. (TSLA)
column35: Delta Air Lines
column36: Inc. (DAL) and Neurocrine Biosciences
column37: Inc. (NBIX)For investors considering getting long
column38: it's nice to know they're placing their chips alongside Warren Buffett too. A cheap and profitable stock that is trading off its highs and has Buffett's seal of approval  that' a winning recipe.Throw in the fact that Delta expects the current June quarter to go well
column39: and presumably the rest of the year
column40: and it wouldn't be surprising for DAL stock to make new highs in 2017. Conservative investors can buy the stock at current prices and use the 200-day moving average as their stop-loss. Currently around $43.60
column41: the 200-day MA is about 4%-6% below current prices
column42: depending on where DAL opens for trading.One last note: Delta Air Lines'conference call is scheduled for 10 a.m. Thursday. column1: This Is The Future Of Energy. Here's How To Invest...;4/12/2017;"Recently my team and I have been telling my readers about a   quiet revolution that's taking place thanks to eccentric   billionaire Elon Musk and his band of scientists at Tesla Motors   (Nasdaq:TSLA).You see
column2: for years they've been working feverishly at their   lab in Fremont
column3: California on a battery that could provide enough   energy to power a house.Last year
column4: news came along that they'd finally broken   through.And now
column5: for the first time in decades
column6: we could see the   entire utility sector turned on its head as a result -- leading   to massive gains for early investors.As you can see
column7: Tesla's battery storage device looks nothing   like your old-fashioned AA battery.It's a sleek
column8: compact unit that you can mount on the wall in   your garage. One single
column9: stand-alone unit delivers enough power   to take an entire home completely off the grid. Simply charge it   with a solar panel
column10: windmill or any other power source
column11: and   you've got all the energy you need.Thanks to Tesla
column12: the world is about to see that an energy   sea-change has been quietly unfolding before their eyes for   several years now.And many of the world's greatest investors are quickly staking   their claims in this new technology.Billionaire venture capitalist Peter Thiel -- the first   outside investor in Facebook -- has poured in millions of dollars   of his own money. (As one of the early supporters of Donald   Trump's presidential run
column13: it's rumored Thiel has the President's   ear
column14: too.)Bill Gates has made not one
column15: but three big investments. And   Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has jumped in as well.But it's not just the brilliance of this energy storage device   that makes it an appealing investment space.It's the timing.You see
column16: this device is going to enter the market at a time   when demand for a product like this has never been higher. In   fact
column17: there are three intriguing factors making this technology   particularly promising.1. U.S. Political SupportBecause of geo-politics and concerns about pollution
column18: governments   are falling over themselves to get more energy storage systems in   place.Take California
column19: for instance. That one single state could   cause every public company in the energy storage industry to soar   triple-digits
column20: thanks to new legislation
column21: mandating that its   largest utilities have enough energy storage capacity to provide   electrical support for 1 million homes.That's the equivalent of building a dam's worth of   infrastructure. And they want it in place by 2020.Keep in mind: when the governments mandate something
column22: it isn't   simply a request. It's the law. If utilities don't comply
column23: they'll be punished. That's why California's largest utilities --   from Con Edison to Pacific Gas and Electric -- are already   jumping on this.Massachusetts is following California's lead. It just launched   a $10 million initiative and aims to be a national leader in   energy storage.And New York
column24: Texas
column25: Oregon
column26: Arizona and other states are   making similar moves.2. Global Political SupportGermany is dedicating $56 million a year specifically for energy   storage. Japan is setting aside $700 million
column27: aiming to be the   ""world leader"" in energy storage. And China is jumping in with   both feet. Its energy storage market is projected to quadruple   over the next decade.The driving factor behind this global push for energy storage   is simple. Reducing pollution.""If China doubles its energy production over the next two   decades
column28: billionaire Peter Thiel points out
column29: ""it will also   double its air pollution. If every one of India's hundreds of   millions of households were to live the way Americans already do   -- using only today's tools -- the result would be   environmentally catastrophic. Spreading old ways to create wealth   around the world will result in devastation
column30: not riches.""In fact
column31: the International Energy Agency has called on world   leaders to spend a combined $380 billion on energy storage by   2050.3. Public SupportBut political support is only half the story. The energy storage   revolution is really being driven by the public at large
column32: and it   all funnels down to one thing.Freedom.For some people
column33: it's freedom from utility companies. They   don't like the fact that utilities are essentially a monopoly and   can raise their rates at a whim. With an energy storage system
column34: you wouldn't have to worry about this.Others want to ""get out from under big brother
column35: as one energy   storage user told USA Today.He and others like him don't trust that the government won't   try to control their energy consumption simply because they're   running their A/C longer than a bureaucrat deems proper.Bottom line:The energy revolution is coming. And Tesla's battery storage   device is just part of the story.Now here's the thing... I'm not recommending you invest in   Tesla. I've identifiedthree little-known stocksthat could soar 10 times higher by 2020 -- and they'll do it by   riding Tesla's coattails.Sure
column36: Tesla is likely to see some nice long-term gains thanks   to this revolution. But the lion's share of the gains will be   found in smaller
column37: lesser-known companies that are making this   technology a reality.Make no mistake: Opportunities like this don't come around   very often. And when the public catches on to this revolution
column38: the big gains will have already been made.You can click here to view my full report.Related ArticlesThe Indicator That Defies Everything You Know       About Value InvestingTest: A Proven System You Should ConsiderA Proven System You Should Consider"

column6: IL - April 11
column7: 2017 - Zacks.com announces the list of stocks featured in the Analyst Blog. Every day the Zacks Equity Research analysts discuss the latest news and events impacting stocks and the financial markets. Stocks recently featured in the blog includeAlphabet Inc.(NASDAQ:GOOGL-Free Report)
column8: Ford(NYSE:F-Free Report)
column9: Tesla Motors(NASDAQ:TSLA-Free Report)
column10: Apple(NASDAQ:AAPL-Free Report)
column11: Snap Inc.(NYSE:SNAP-Free Report) andTwilio Inc.(NYSE:TWLO-Free Report).Today
column12: Zacks is promoting its ''Buy'' stock recommendations.Get #1Stock of the Day pick for free.Here are highlights from Monday's Analyst Blog:Will Uber Be the Hottest IPO of 2017?y now
column13: I think we all know what Uber is
column14: what it does
column15: and how it makes our lives easier. Have too many groceries? Get an Uber. Too drunk? Get an Uber. Stressful day at work? Uber. Like magic-now
column16: it's really an expectation-any transportation woes vanish with the digital sight of a car heading your way.Launched only seven years ago
column17: Uber Technologies Inc.is an app-based transportation company headquartered in San Francisco
column18: California
column19: and operates in about 270 cities and more than 60 countries worldwide. Using the app is easy: just type in your current location
column20: where you want to go
column21: and hit request Uber. From there
column22: Uber uses its app to receive its ride requests
column23: sending them out to drivers who transport customers to their final destination.Increased CompetitionThe emergence of on-demand rides has become a popular business venture all over the world
column24: but it has proved difficult for companies to break away from the congested pack. At the end of 2015
column25: Sidecar
column26: another on-demand car service
column27: officially stopped offering rides and deliveries.In addition to the now-defunct Sidecar
column28: companies like Lyft
column29: Curb
column30: Southeast Asia-based Grab
column31: India's Ola
column32: and especially China's Didi Chuxing have all started to eat into the ride-hailing market share
column33: becominghuge competitorsfor Uber. Didi is arguably Uber's biggest threat overseas
column34: and the ride-sharing giant conceded defeat in August
column35: selling its UberChina operationsto Didi and ending an expensive
column36: bruising battle between the two companies.Even Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL-Free Report) is becoming a threat to Uber
column37: with plans to make its self-driving cars unit a stand-alone business. This initiative could put the company in direct competition with Uber
column38: as the lack of a driver could keep costs down in the long-term. The company's Google division also recently began a pilot program with Waze
column39: a company they acquired in 2013
column40: that enables thousands of San Francisco commuters to join carpools; Waze also offers real-time driving directions based on information from other drivers.Self-Driving
column41: Uber StyleBut Uber is right on Google's heels
column42: and asself-driving car technologybecomes more commercially available
column43: Uber has been constantly beefing up its business strategies focused on autonomous driving. Back in September
column44: it began testing its self-driving Ford (NYSE:F-Free Report) Fusions in Pittsburgh; engineers rode in the driver's seat
column45: ready to take over whenever things got tricky.Uber then introduced self-driving Volvo XC90s to San Francisco in December
column46: and riders who requested an uberX were matched with one of these vehicles if one was available. Just days later
column47: however
column48: the California Department of Motor Vehicles revoked the registrations for its self-driving cars
column49: as the company didn't have the proper permits.But Uber being Uber
column50: the fleet of Volvos were on their way to Arizona within days. Uber already operates a self-driving car program in the state
column51: and in 2015
column52: partnered with the University of Arizona to research mapping technology.Uber also recently acquired a car start-up Otto
column53: which specializes in self-driving trucks. Otto is a 90-person company
column54: and its co-founder
column55: Anthony Levandowski
column56: will now lead Uber into the self-driving car market. Impressively
column57: Otto engineers have worked at Tesla Motors (NASDAQ:TSLA-Free Report)
column58: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL-Free Report)
column59: and Google
column60: and with this knowledge and expertise
column61: Uber is bound to be a top player in the self-driving car industry.ControversyWhile Uber has seen great success
column62: it's journey has been a bumpy one. The company has been in and out of the news thanks to a number of recent legal (Alphabet iscurrently suingthem for theft of its self-driving car technology) and reputation-hurting (note the company'ssexual harassment scandaland CEO Travis Kalanick's rude behavior towards a driver) headlines. And from noncompliance issues in New York City to regulatory concerns and lack of driver background checks
column63: Uber has drawn scrutiny and criticism
column64: and has even been banned in The Netherlands and in parts of Thailand
column65: India
column66: and China.It's no secret that traditional taxi services are not happy with the rise of Uber and other ride-hailing companies
column67: and many argue that Uber should be subject to the same regulations that they face. In dozens of cities it has moved in to
column68: Uber has faced intense opposition
column69: lobbying
column70: and legal challenges against it from these taxi companies.Uber has also been embroiled in along-standing battlewith its drivers. A group of drivers first sued the company back in 2013
column71: claiming they should be classified as employees rather than independent contractors. As a result
column72: Uber had been set to pay up to $100 million in reimbursement damages to almost 400
column73: 000 drivers
column74: but recently
column75: a federal judge in California ruled that the settlement was unfair.But as the saying goes
column76: any publicity is good publicity
column77: and all of the bad press has yet to really negatively affect Uber. Despitelosing over $1 billionin the first half of 2016
column78: Uber gained just as much revenue in that same time period. Its ability to raise exorbitant amounts of money is incredibly impressive for a company who is less than a decade old
column79: and this skill makes Uber that much more attractive to venture capital investors.IPO PotentialDespite these controversies
column80: investors are eagerly awaiting an Uber IPO. Many have believed
column82: the company would go public for a few years now
column83: but Mr. Kalanick wants ""to make sure [an IPO] happens as late as possible
column84: said in an interview with CNBC last year.If and when Uber finally decides to go public
column85: its potential would depend on the broader IPO market and economic environment. According to Renaissance Capital
column86: IPOs only raised a paltry $18.9 billion in 2016
column87: with annual proceeds falling to the lowest level since 2003. Just four companies filed public offerings that grossed over $1 billion.Looking ahead
column88: it's difficult to pinpoint how busy the IPO market will be this year. Snap Inc. (NYSE:SNAP-Free Report)
column90: finally made that giant step last month
column91: but it's hard to say what
column97: Uber-will follow. And recent high-growth IPOs like Twilio Inc. (NYSE:TWLO-Free Report) have traded strongly since their debut
column98: a good sign for tech companies everywhere looking to make their trading debut.How Might Uber Perform?An IPO for Uber could be massive for both the company and Wall Street. It's currently valued at $68 billion after a total of nine rounds of funding worth $12.9 billion since its launch. And thanks to Uber's structure-a unique combination of transportation company
column100: and real world engineering-the company has been touted as one of the best future IPOs.It's IPO
column103: but let one number stay in your mind: $68 billion. Let me write that again: $68 billion. This number is a hard one to forget
column104: and a figure that will be on the forefront of many investors' minds come the time of its public offering
column105: as it impressively showcases just how far this startup has come in a few short years.Today

column12: Inc.(NASDAQ:TSLA-Free Report) building a factory in China have surfaced once again. Southern Metropolis Daily
