column1: 3 Top Driverless Car Stocks to Buy Now;4/4/2017;"I won't bore you with the statistics about self-driving cars.   At least
column2: not yet. First
column3: consider this 2015 quote about the   future of driverless cars fromTesla(NASDAQ: TSLA) CEO Elon Musk:You'll be able to tell your car
column4: ""Take me home
column5: go here
column6: go     there
column7: or anything
column8: and it'll just do it. It'll be an order of     magnitude safer than a person. In the distant future
column9: people     may outlaw driving cars because it's too dangerous. You can't     have a person driving a two-ton death machine.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();That opinion may seem a bit extreme to some
column10: but self-driving   cars have the potential to reduce vehicular deaths by (here come   the stats now) 90% by mid-century. In the U.S. alone
column11: that means   nearly 30
column12: 000 lives would be saved every year.That's one of the reasons why so many automakers and   technology companies are investing billions of dollars to get   autonomous vehicles on the road
column13: and why investors should pay   attention. To help you get started in the space
column14: let's look at   three companies that are each taking different approaches to the   self-driving car market -- and that have lots of potential to   benefit from it.IntelIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) wasn't exactly the first company people were   thinking about in this space until very recently. That changed   when it purchased the leader in advanced driver assistance   systems (ADAS)
column15: Mobileye(NYSE: MBLY)
column16: for $15.3 billion.That's a hefty price tag
column17: but what Intel is getting for it may   end up being worth it. Advanced driver assistance systems -- with   features such as lane detection and correction
column18: automatic   braking
column19: and automatic speed adjustments -- are the precursors to   much of the technology that will underlie fully autonomous   vehicles
column20: and Mobileye has about 65% of the ADAS market.   Purchasing it gave Intel a central position in autonomous vehicle   technologies that it didn't have just a month ago; it could also   help the company sell more of its processors.Processors for PCs have been Intel's No. 1 revenue   driver
column21: but with sales of desktops and laptops continuing to   decline
column22: the company has been looking for new segments that it   can sell its chips to. The automotive semiconductor market is   expected to reach $36 billion by 2018
column23: and if Intel can use   Mobileye to both sell self-driving technologies to automakers and   boost sales of its own processors
column24: then the company may have   finally found its next big market opportunity.QualcommIf Intel's pending purchase of Mobileye signals a move from   the post-PC and post-mobile era for chipmakers
column25: then considerQualcomm(NASDAQ: QCOM)  one of theleaders of that movement.At the end of last year
column26: Qualcomm made a $39 billion bid forNXP Semiconductors(NASDAQ: NXPI)
column27: which is still pending. The move would do much   to bring Qualcomm into the driverless car space by adding NXP's   own self-driving technologies to the chipmaker's lineup.NXP debuted anoff-the-shelf driverless car systemlast year called BlueBox
column28: which includes sensors
column29: cameras
column30: algorithms
column31: and processors that allow cars to function at Level 4   automation by 2020. (Level 5 is the highest classification for a   fully autonomous vehicle.)Qualcomm has hit a few bumps as it works to close the NXP   deal
column32: but that appears to still be on track to happen later this   year. When it does
column33: Qualcomm could end up in a similar position   to Intel
column34: with a handful of key driverless car technologies in   its arsenal and new opportunities to sell its processors into   driverless cars.TeslaI couldn't lead off this list with an Elon Musk quote without   eventually talking about everything Tesla is doing in the   semi-autonomous car space.First of all
column35: Tesla has added driverless car hardware to all   of its new vehicles
column36: and has beenrolling out software updatesas they are developed to bring new semi-autonomous features to   vehicle owners. Tesla is the only automaker that's taking   such a bold step with semi-autonomous hardware
column37: which could end   up helping the company take the lead in driverless cars a few   years from now.Musk mentioned in the second version of hisTesla Master Planlast year that vehicles owners will be able to ""summon your Tesla   from pretty much anywhere. Once it picks you up
column38: you will be able   to sleep
column39: read or do anything else enroute to your destination.""   Tesla is still a while away from that goal
column40: but it's clearly   positioning itself as the leading semi-autonomous automaker.The driverless car market is expected to be worth $77 billion   by 2035
column41: but there areplenty of thingsthat could end up holding these companies back. Still
column42: investors   would be wise to consider the above companies when looking at   driverless car stocks -- and remember that patient investors will   likely see the biggest returns.10 stocks we like better than TeslaWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Tesla (TSLA) Runs Over Naysayers
column2: Races Past Ford in Market Cap;4/4/2017;"Tesla (Shutterstock photo)Doubt has been worn like a badge of honor by naysayers when placing bets against Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk. Hows that playing out? Smart investors
column3: on the other hand  those who have latched onto Musks promises  have gotten rich calling shotgun. For your sake
column4: you were on the right side of the trade Monday.Tesla stock raced more than 7% higher Monday
column5: reaching to an all-time high of $299. The stock
column6: which has has already soared 40% year to date
column7: besting the 5% rise in the S&P 500 index
column8: has pushed Tesla ahead of Ford (F) in terms of market cap. The California-based electric vehicle company
column9: which on Sunday said it delivered 25
column10: 000 cars in the first quarter
column11: is now valued at about $3B more than Ford
column12: which sold more than 236
column13: 000 cars in March alone.makeArticleAd();At it current pace
column14: Tesla  only fourteen years old  is poised to surpass 120-year old General Motors (GM)
column15: which has a market cap $51 billion as of Mondays close. Tesla has punished the short sellers
column16: who held almost 20% of the float as of March 15. These days
column17: doubt  that once distinctive emblem
column18: purported to be intelligence  has been replaced by the marks of tire treads as Tesla continues to run over its enemies and its own estimates.On January 3  when TSLA stock traded at around $213  I made a case for why the shares would be dominant in 2017
column19: posting as much as 60% returns. Much of the optimism was based on the premise that Musk would make good on his promise that Model 3 deliveries will begin in 2017. Teslas ability to deliver $35
column20: 000 Model 3 vehicles would inject significant cash flow to the companys given there is a waiting list of about 400
column21: 000 people who have each paid a $1
column22: 000 as a registration fee.Beyond the Model 3
column23: on Sunday not only did Tesla top its own delivery forecast of 23
column25: 500 vehicles
column26: marking an almost 70% rise year over year
column27: the company now expects to deliver between 47
column29: 000 cars in the first half of 2017. This [47
column30: 000 delivery target] bodes well for the company and should add to recent positive sentiment for Tesla's fundamental performance
column31: said CFRA Research analyst Efriam Levy.All told
column32: the fortunes of Tesla and the credibility of Elon Musk have taken a right turn. And while Tesla is still losing money taking on larger players Ford and GM
column33: which are both deep-pocketed
column34: it is TSLA investors who are cruising all the way to the bank. Seatbelts are optional."

column1: Tesla Stock Nears $300: What Investors Need to Know;4/3/2017;"Tesla(NASDAQ: TSLA) stock is surging on Monday
column2: following the   company'srecord first-quarter deliveries. Shares are up about 6.6% at the time of the writing
column3: trading at   about $297. The rise adds to the stock's roaring gains recently
column4: with shares up an impressive 63% since Dec. 1.As the stock hits a new all-time high on Monday and nears   $300
column5: it's a good time take a step back and consider what's   behind the rising stock price -- and what it means for   investors.Tesla Model X (left) and Model S (right). Image source.     Tesla.makeArticleAd();Tesla's Model X is a hitAs vehicle sales soar 69% year over year in Tesla's most   recent quarter
column6: one recent and undeniable key driver for the   company is its late-2015 launched Model X SUV.After its launch in 2015
column7: there were lots of doubts about both   Tesla's ability to produce such a complex vehicle and about how   demand for the Model X's flashy falcon wing doors would fare.   Further
column8: Tesla's first few quarters of worse-than-expected Model   X production -- as management cited ""hubris in adding far too   much new technology to the Model X in version 1"" -- didn't help   concerns about the vehicle's potential.However
column9: with Model X deliveries in the company's first   quarter of 2017 up 318% year over year
column10: Tesla has proven it can   both ramp up production and build the vehicle in meaningful   volumes. Tesla delivered a record 11
column11: 550 Model X units in its   first quarter
column12: up from 2
column13: 400 units in the year-ago quarter.Data source: Tesla's quarterly SEC filings and delivery     updates. Chart by author.Model 3 is comingAnother key driver in Tesla's stock recently is management's   ability to stick to its aggressive timeline for its upcoming   Model 3 so far. In early 2016
column14: management was still saying it   didn't expect Model 3 production to begin until ""late 2017."" But   after announcing in May last year that management was moving its   target for annualized production of 500
column15: 000 units two years   earlier
column16: from 2020 to 2018
column17: the company has also been moving its   Model 3 launch timeframe earlier.Now Tesla is aiming for Model 3 production to begin in July.   In addition
column18: Tesla is maintaining its aggressive guidance for a   500
column19: 000-unit annualized build rate next year. Notably
column20: Tesla is   only building about 100
column21: 000 units annually today
column22: so even if   Tesla fell short of its target to build 500
column23: 000 vehicles in 2018   by 150
column24: 000 units
column25: production would still soar.With Tesla delivering strong Model S and Model X deliveries in   the first quarter
column26: and management setting the stage for Model 3
column27: investors are betting on hockey-stick-like growth in the   company's underlying business.Tesla stock's valuation implies monstrous growthAs shares hit a fresh high
column28: investors should keep in mind that   the stock's valuation is now essentially betting on not only   excellent execution with the Model 3
column29: but also sustained growth   in the company's overall business for years to come.Model 3. Image source: Tesla.To better grasp the massive future growth priced into Tesla   stock
column30: consider that the electric-car maker has sold about 86
column31: 500   vehicles in the trailing 12 months
column32: yet its market capitalization   of $48.4 billion is several billion dollars greater thanFord's at the time of this writing. And Ford
column33: of course
column34: sells   millions of vehicles per year -- 6.65 million in 2016
column35: to be   exact.Of course
column36: Tesla is betting on more than vehicle sales to   boost its business. Indeed
column37: that's why the company recently   dropped ""Motors"" from its name. Tesla is betting itsfast-growing energy storage business
column38: 2016 acquisition of SolarCity
column39: andrapid deployment of autonomous vehicle   technologywill all become significant growth drivers.Given the speculative nature of the growth expectations built   into Tesla's stock price today
column40: investors should consider risks   associated with the stock carefully before buying.10 stocks we like better than FordWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock       tip
column41: it can pay to listen. After all
column42: the newsletter they       have run for over a decade
column43: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column44: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now...and Ford wasn't one of them!       That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better       buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of April 3

column21: '');Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column22: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column23: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column24: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased
column25: while destruction of units involves selling underlying holdings
column26: so large flows can also impact the individual components held within ETFs.Click here to find out which 9 other ETFs had   notable inflows "

column9: S.A.(NYSE:CPA).Copa is based in Panama City
column10: Panama
column11: perfectly situated between North and South America. Efficiently run
column12: the currency/economic issues facing Latin America over the last couple of years really took the steam out of its stock
column13: a fact I'm painfully aware of.10 Stocks You'd Be Foolish to Buy Right NowIn December 2013
column14: I wrote an article entitled
column15: The 5 Best Stocks to Buy for the Next 20 Years.Unfortunately
column16: I recommended CPA stock near its all-time high of $162.83

column19: Inc.(NASDAQ:ECHO) 0.80%Universal Display Corporation(NASDAQ:OLED) 34.9% Copa Holdings -10.2%SVB Financial Group(NASDAQ:SIVB)19.5%Amazon.com
column20: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)27.9% Overall 17.3%SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust(NYSEARCA:SPY)8.8%Why Do I Like Copa and Not UAL Stock?There's not one thing I can put my finger on that screams buy one over the other. However
column21: Latin America is expected to see GDP growth in 2017 of1.5%
column22: its best showing since 2013. Panama is the fastest-growing economy in Latin America; projected GDP growth in 2017 is 6.4%
column23: a continuation of a multi-year economic boom in its home country.It has71737-Max's on order with the first to arrive in 2018. Its fleet is already young with an average age of seven years and heading lower on the delivery of the new planes.That will help lower fuel costs and increase margins. Copa management estimate cost reduction initiatives like this will add 100 basis points to its EBIT margin in 2017; other strategies including the recovery of the Latin American economies should add another 10 percentage points to its EBIT margins by 2019.Earnings drive share prices higher.In the first two months of the year
column24: Copa has seen traffic improve with a3.5%increase in available seat miles (ASM)
column25: an 8.9% increase in revenue seat miles (RSM) and load factor is up on a year-to-date basis by 410 basis points to 82.4%. If Copa were a hotel (load factor is basically the same thing as occupancy) the owners would be very happy.Copa expects its 2017 ASM to grow by 6%
column26: 450 basis points higher than its growth this past year. Equally important it expects to improve operating margins by as much as 460 basis points to 17%. Load factor is projected to be 80%; its adjusted breakeven load factor in 2016 was 70.7%.Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Is a No-Doubt Buy After Deliveries Beat""Copa Holdings fourth quarter results reflect the continuous improvement in the demand environment
column27: Copa management commented in its Q3 2016 earnings release. ""Additionally
column28: good commercial execution and capacity discipline have allowed the company to make the most of improving traffic trends and to deliver historically high load factors.""Bottom Line on UAL StockWhile airlines like UAL stock in the U.S. are experiencing slowertrafficso far in 2017
column29: Copa is full speed ahead and it's only going to get better inQ2 2018when the south terminal expansion in Panama City opens for business.The biggest risk with owning Copa stock is the fact it operates in a politically unstable region of the world bringing an element of the unknown to your investment.However
column30: its management team would not be out of place in Chicago where United Airlines is based or Atlanta or any of the other cities where U.S. airlines are headquartered. Its CEO
column31: Pedro Heilbron
column32: has been in the top job since1988; he understands the issues that Latin American businesses face every day. Several of its senior people have worked with U.S. airlines including United Airlines.For me
column33: it's not so much I feel UAL stock is a bad stock
column34: but rather that Copa is a better one.That said
column35: the risk might be too much for the average retail investor; I get that. But if you're at all familiar with Latin America
column36: I think you ought to at least consider it.As of this writing

column1: EV Smart Charging Takes a Big Step Forward;4/1/2017;"As the number of electric vehicles on the road grows

column1: These Popular Stocks Could Prove Toxic for Your Portfolio;3/31/2017;"Sometimes
column2: stocks that seem like great investments can go bad.   Companies with good numbers or a strong story can have flaws that   aren't readily visible to most investors. Even good   companies can hit roadblocks
column3: or situations where there's a lot   more at risk than is apparent.We asked three of our Fool contributors to name companies that   are popular with investors but stand a chance of turning toxic.   Here's why they're concerned aboutTesla(NASDAQ: TSLA)
column4: Verizon Communications(NYSE: VZ)
column5: andTeva Pharmaceutical Industries(NYSE: TEVA).Make-or-break moment for a market favoriteJohn Rosevear(Tesla):Few companies have generated the excitement among investors that   Tesla has over the last several years. There are good   reasons to be excited: CEO Elon Musk is a charismatic leader with   big ideas; Tesla's cars are a step ahead of the big automakers'   in several important ways; and the company's growth potential (in   cars
column6: in solar panels
column7: in batteries) seems nearly limitless.makeArticleAd();So why might Tesla prove ""toxic""? It's because the company is   at a genuine make-or-break moment. There's a real risk that   things could go awry over the next year
column8: and I don't think   investors have properly recognized that risk.Tesla's valuation rests in large part on the assumption that   it will become a mass-market automaker
column9: selling hundreds of   thousands or even millions of vehicles year after year.  To   get there
column10: its upcoming Model 3 has to be great -- and here's the   thing: It has to begreat in some ways that Tesla's current vehicles   aren't.Tesla's Model 3 has to be Toyota-good -- or mass-market     buyers will pass. Image source: Tesla.That's where the risk lies. There's a lot to like about   Tesla's current products
column11: the Model S and Model X. But as even   most Tesla fans will acknowledge
column12: the truth is that both have   weaknesses in their designs that show Tesla's inexperience as an   automaker. That hasn't been a problem for Tesla so far: Its early   adopter fans have been mostly very willing to forgive things like   iffy seats
column13: crooked panel gaps
column14: and dodgy door handles in order   to be first with Tesla's genuinely impressive whiz-bang   technology.But this is the moment where Tesla has to gobeyondthe early adopters and establish that it can sell vehicles to   hundreds of thousands (eventually
column15: millions) of buyers every   year. Mass-market car buyers might love Tesla's tech
column16: but if the   Model 3's fit and finish
column17: comfort
column18: and reliability isn't up toToyotaorBMWstandards
column19: then the tech might not be enough. That will be   especially true once the big automakers start to launch credible   electric rivals to the Model 3
column20: as they will -- soon.So here's why Tesla could turn toxic: There's a real risk that   the Model 3 will fall short of the quality and   finish expectations that mass-market car buyers have come to   expect. If it does
column21: then Tesla will have a lot of trouble   sustaining the pace of sales its investors expect
column22: and its stock   price will suffer accordingly.Big bets and tough competitionReuben Gregg Brewer(Verizon Communications Inc.):Verizon Communicationsis one of the largest telecommunications companies in the United   States. It sports a fat 4.7% yield backed by 10 years of dividend   increases. You'd think Verizon would be an easy stock to love as   the world goes increasingly mobile. But I have a couple of   concerns.My first is Verizon's push into content. The goal appears to   be expanding its reach from simply supplying the cellular   connection that allows content consumption to also controlling at   least some of the content that's consumed. However
column23: Verizon is   going about it by acquiring internet companies
column24: like AOL
column25: that   have struggled after finding early success. Buying second-rate   assets in the hope of a business resurrection isn't a great plan   in my book. It's going to take a lot of cash to turn these   businesses around
column26: or -- my bigger fear -- the effort will be a   complete waste of time and shareholders' money.My other concern is the resurgence of unlimited data plans
column27: increasingly at very low prices. In fact
column28: my wife and I just   switched from metered plans at Verizon andAT&T
column29: respectively
column30: to a competitor offering unlimited data for the   same or better prices. Verizon and AT&T have no choice but to   compete with smaller
column31: more aggressive cellphone companies because   there's little product differentiation today. In my mind
column32: this   industry dynamic puts Verizon at the mercy of its most desperate   competitors at a time when it's making risky investments that may   not pan out. That's a recipe for disaster in my book.Too many problemsKeith Speights(Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd.):At first glance
column33: you might think that Teva is a great drug stock   to add to your portfolio. The company experienced a solid boost   to revenue last year. Teva stock appears to be priced   inexpensively
column34: with shares trading at less than seven times   estimated earnings. And we can't forget Teva's dividend
column35: which   currently yields over 4%.The true picture for Teva isn't nearly as good as those facts   indicate
column36: however. While the company did make higher revenue in   2016
column37: its earnings sank. That low stock valuation reflects   expectations that Teva's earnings challenges won't be fixed   anytime soon. As for the dividend
column38: the drugmaker returned a much   higher amount of money to shareholders through dividend payments   than it made in profits.Teva's biggest challenge right now is that its key patents for   Copaxone 40 mg/mL have been invalidated by a U.S. District Court.   The multiple sclerosis drug is Teva's top seller
column39: contributing   more than 19% of total revenue.On top of all this
column40: Teva is searching for a new CEO. Former   CEO Erez Vigodman left the company in February. His   resignation followed the departure of Sigurdur Olafsson two   months earlier. Olafsson had led Teva's generic-drug   business.Don't be tempted by the cheap valuation and high dividend   yield. Teva might eventually get its house in order
column41: but for now   the best course of action is to stay away.10 stocks we like better than TeslaWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column42: it can pay to listen. After all
column43: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column44: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column45: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Tesla wasn't one of them!     That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better     buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

The Motley Fool owns     shares of and recommends Tesla and Verizon Communications. The     Motley Fool recommends BMW and Teva Pharmaceutical Industries.     The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe decision byTencent Holdings Ltd(OTCMKTS:TCEHY) to buy 5% ofTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) for $1.7 billion seems to have caught out the company's short sellers.makeArticleAd();TSLA stock is up more than 30% so far in 2017

column10: 712 cars in January. Tesla
column11: meanwhile
column12: delivered 76

column15: California
column16: production plant
column17: which would make that factory the most productive in the world.10 Stocks You'd Be Foolish to Buy Right NowBob Lutz
column18: who at 85 has held top jobs at all of America's ""big three"" automakers
column19: is among those who is not amused.""They lose money on every car
column20: they have a constant cash drain
column21: and yet everyone talks as if this is the most miraculous automobile company of all time
column22: he toldTheLos Angeles Timesrecently.Yet Musk is still able to get smart companies like Tencent to advance cash
column23: based on promises
column24: likesolar roofs that cost no more than regular roofs- promises he has yet to fulfill.Tesla's Problem Is ScaleLike others here atInvestorPlace
column25: I cover Tesla regularly. I find the fundamentals to be completely out of whack with the valuation. And I recommended selling the stock in January when it was trading at $254
column26: notingit was at the top of its trading range.Within a month
column27: TSLA stock was at $280 per share and is now trading within a few dollars of that figure. So what do I know
column28: right?James Brumley may be correct- that the Tencent underwriting is a huge buy signal. Even before ink was dry on that deal
column29: Musk himself was off founding yet-another new company
column30: Neuralink
column31: which will work on man-computer interfaces.More big dreams.While most other technology executives were nonplussed by Donald Trump
column32: Musk rushed to his side
column33: causing one news site to label him a ""crony capitalist."" He has even deleted tweets critical of the administration.But one thing he has not been able to do
column34: in all his rushing around among Tesla
column35: Neuralink
column36: SpaceXandSolarCity(which Tesla bought last year) is scale. Musk dreams big
column37: Musk plans big  but Musk delivers small. When someone points out the distance between his promises and delivery
column38: he simply dreams another dream
column39: or spins his reality distortion field around another investor
column40: relentlessly charming a disbelieving world.Trade of the Day: Advanced Micro Devices
column41: Inc. (NASDAQ:AMD)All the while
column42: TSLA stock soars.Bottom Line on TSLA StockThis is what capitalism is supposed to be about: big egos with big dreams creating big change. But at some point
column43: that change must happen at scale. At some point
column44: promises must be fulfilled or the dreamer gets written off as a con artist.Maybe in the age of Trump
column45: those rules no longer apply. Maybe in the age of Musk
column46: there is no longer such a thing as financial gravity. But that still is not the way to bet.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column47: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing

column1: Tesla Model Y: New Information Coming Next Week?;3/30/2017;"Don't get too excited.Tesla's(NASDAQ: TSLA) Model Y
column2: which will be a smaller and cheaper   version of the electric-car company's Model X SUV

But it makes more sense   when the vehicle is put into the context of Tesla's breakneck   growth ambitions.Tesla vehicle production. column1: 3 Reasons Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Could Retreat;3/30/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIt's hard to findAmazon.com
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) bears most days
column5: especially when the stock is continually resetting all-time highs. Less than 2% of Amazon's float is sold short
column6: meaning even at these heights
column7: very few bears are willing to bet against AMZN stock.makeArticleAd();Yet
column8: here and there
column9: contrarians get the best of Amazon
column10: which has been prone to the occasional sharp setback amid its multiyear race through the stratosphere. The start of 2016 saw Amazon shares pull back by more than 25% in about a month-and-a-half
column11: and AMZN yielded about 15% of ground between mid-October and mid-November of last year.In fact
column12: even I'm a long-term bull on Amazon
column13: but I'm also cautious - it pays to be. So right now
column14: I'm paying attention to three near-term headwinds that could keep Amazon stock from pushing to even higher prices
column15: and could make AMZN stock a good prospect for quick bearish options trades.Here's a look at three things that could hold Amazon back over the next month or so:Headwinds for AMZN StockA Recent Defeat:Amazon just announced yesterday that it's putting the kibosh on Quidsi
column16: the operator of six shopping sites
column17: foremost of which is Diapers.com. While AMZN isn't known for making big-ticket acquisitions
column18: the Quidsi purchase in 2011 for $545 million still ranks among the company's top five.The 7 WORST Stocks to Buy Right NowThe rationale?""We have worked extremely hard for the past seven years to get Quidsi to be profitable
column19: and unfortunately we have not been able to do so. Quidsi has great brand expertise and they will continue to offer selection on Amazon.com; the software development team will focus on building technology for AmazonFresh.""AMZN is known for testing ideas with the willingness to accept failure
column20: but there's something to be said about that failurea.)coming from an acquisition andb.)dealing with the core business of online retail.Quidsi has an additional barb that could stick in Amazon's craw. Co-founder and former CEO Marc Lore
column21: who was brought over to Amazon as part of the acquisition
column22: left after a few years to found Jet.com  whichWal-Mart Stores Inc(NYSE:WMT) bought out in 2016
column23: giving the big-box retailer much more ammunition on the online front.Amazon Go Delays:Amazon had Wall Street and Main Street alike singing of the coming death of other brick-and-mortar grocers in late December when it announcedAmazon Go- a new store concept that would change the way consumers shopoffline.The concept: Customers walk in and activate the Amazon Go app. They're then free to walk about the building
column24: shop as they like
column25: and leave without checking out. Instead
column26: it uses sensors and other technology to determine what you've bought
column27: and it charges you accordingly.This announcement drove a lot of excitement in AMZN stock
column28: but the company recently admitted that it's not ready for a proper launch
column29: and might not be for some time. Amazon
column30: which is testing the concept in Seattle
column31: can't track more than 20 customers simultaneously and is having difficulty tracking items once they're in customers' possession.So now
column32: whereas Amazon was expecting a public launch by the end of March
column33: the timetable has been pushed back indefinitely
column34: dependent on when the company works out the kinks.For what it's worth
column35: this isn't necessarily a bearish development for Amazon stock so much as it is  well
column36: a delay. While investors were rabid about the concept
column37: seeing the actual practical application will simply take more time to play out. In a way
column38: AMZN's prudence is a positive
column39: not rushing the concept to launch and instead making sure that when Amazon Go goes live
column40: it's on point.Advanced Micro Devices
column41: Inc. (AMD) Stock Will Hit New Highs in WeeksTechnicals:On the upside
column42: Amazon's push to all-time highs has cracked any sort of overhead technical resistance. The stock is now trading above all of its major moving averages after bouncing off its 50-day MA just a few days ago.In fact
column43: the only real downside is that the stock is starting to look overbought from a technical perspective according to the Relative Strength Index (RSI).It's not a perfect guide
column44: and many stocks can continue to rise despite greatly overbought RSI. However
column45: AMZN stock tends to respect this indicator - for instance
column46: the October-November decline came after just a couple of weeks of overbought readings here.Bottom Line on AMZN StockNone of these three headwinds alone is a reason to worry about Amazon shares over the long haul
column47: or even for the back half of this year.And valuation isn't worth mentioning
column48: other than to say that while AMZN is trading at a triple-digit forward price-to-earnings ratio
column49: that's never really mattered.Nonetheless
column50: Amazon stock is starting to look technically frothy
column51: by its standards
column52: and with the company's next earnings report not due until late April
column53: minor negative drivers could get the best of shares for the next month or so.This could be a good time to buy puts on AMZN
column54: or attempt other bearish options strategies that benefit from flat to slightly lower trading.As of this writing
column55: Robert Martin did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceWhy Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Is Downright DangerousIf Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Has a Shot at a Breakout

column1: 3 Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy for Monster Profits;3/30/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThere are a lot of big-time shifts happening in the tech space right now
column3: from the expansion of e-commerce to autonomous vehicles and virtual reality. While investors may disagree about which of those trends is a good bet for their portfolios
column4: artificial intelligence is one area that most believe will see exponential growth in the years to come.makeArticleAd();Source: iStock.com/carloscastillaNearly every industry
column5: from healthcare to finance and banking
column6: is finding ways to use machine learning and AI in order to improve security
column7: efficiency
column8: training and even the customer experience. That means there will be plenty of opportunities for growth in the AI industry in the decade to come
column9: so investors should be on the hunt for stocks to buy in this space.10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 MonthsAlmost anyone who calls themselves a tech company is exploring AI in one way or another
column10: but the stocks to buy in this space areInternational Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM)
column11: Nvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) andAmazon.com
column12: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN).AI Stocks to Buy: International Business Machines Corp. (IBM)Source: ShutterstockIBM has had a tumultuous few years as technology changed and the firm's hardware offerings became antiquated.However
column13: that was then and this is now - it's safe to say that IBM has successfully orchestrated a turnaround and the stock is on the upswing. The firm has done a lot of work to turn itself around over the last few years
column14: but the most promising of IBM's ventures is Watson
column15: a supercomputer capable of machine learning.Watson is able to sift through huge reams of data while constantly identifying new patterns and learning as it goes. That may sound like a pretty cool party trick
column16: but Watson could revolutionize the healthcare industry by helping doctors make better diagnoses and using patients' data to find new correlations between symptoms and conditions that may never have occurred to the medical community.And healthcare is just the beginning
column17: Watson is seen helping withsecurity
column18: training and evencyber-bullying.AI Stocks to Buy:Nvidia Corporation (NVDA)Source: ShutterstockGraphics chipmaker NVDA is another smart play in the AI industry
column19: because the firm's processors have been touted as top of the line. NVDA's GPUs have been praised by automakers likeTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA)
column20: who are planning to use the chipsin upcoming models that will have autonomous driving features.NVDA is a good bet because the firm is not only an AI play
column21: but it is an autonomous vehicle investment as well. The company has ingrained itself in the autonomous driving space
column22: and as automobiles get more and more advanced
column23: Nvidia chips will be powering those improvements.The 7 Best Stocks to Buy for an Income-Rich RetirementHowever
column24: self-driving cars aren't the only catalysts for NVDA in the AI space.The firm has also seen massive revenue growthin gaming
column25: professional visualization and its data center business. Nvidia has made a name for itself as an AI firm and the company is likely to ride the growing wave of AI potential throughout the next decade.AI Stocks to Buy:Amazon.com
column26: Inc. (AMZN)Source: ShutterstockYou can't talk about AI stocks to buy without including e-commerce giant Amazon on the list. The firm has been pouring resources into the development of its AI arm
column27: saying it has the potential to become one of the firm's core businesses.AMZN's virtual assistant Alexa is a prime example of the firm's potential in the AI space. She boasts thousands of commands and is constantly learning the more she is used by customers. Amazon has made it a priority to improve speech recognition and Alexa is blazing the trail ahead.Not only that
column28: but AMZN is using its AI know-how to create cashier-less grocery stores that will allow shoppers to simply log-in to the store
column29: put the items they want into their bags and walk out. The concept would eliminate the need to wait in line or open your wallet
column30: instead charging customers through their Amazon account.The best thing about AMZN's AI developments is that the company has the resources to develop and implement them all by itself. Amazon is working on everything fromfloating warehousesthat supply delivery drones to an all-inclusive Prime ecosystem that is able to anticipate a customer's need before they realize it themselves. The firm's focus on innovation in the AI space will not only benefit AMZN's other businesses
column31: but it will make Amazon a major player within the industry.As of this writing
column32: Laura Hoy was long AMZN.The post3 Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy for Monster Profitsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Will Lose Its App Store Crown to Android;3/30/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsA new report has been released with comprehensive stats for the global market for mobile apps. App Annie says thatApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) served up a fraction of the downloads ofAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column3: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google Play for 2016
column4: yet continued to dominate the revenue side of the business.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleApple's App Store revenue is predicted to continue topping Google Play as the most lucrative through to 2021. It's expected that all Android app stores combined will overtake Apple's App Store sales at some point this year.Report on Mobile App Downloads and RevenueApp Annie is a firm that tracks global app downloads and app store revenue. A detailed report - which was made available onAppleInsider- sheds light onwhat's currently happening in the mobile app market
column5: along with forecasts to 2021.According to App Annie
column6: AAPL's App Store revenue is about to be surpassed for the first time by the combination of Google Play and third party Android app stores. While Apple remained on top for 2016
column7: with $34 billion in app sales versus a combined $27 billion for Android
column8: in 2017 the lead is expected to shift. Apple App Store revenue is pegged at $40 billion
column9: while Android app stores are on track to book a combined $41 billion.The 7 Best Stocks to Buy for an Income-Rich RetirementApple continues to be on top as the single largest app store by sales
column10: with its $40 billion for 2017 expected to nearly double second place Google Play's $21 billion. Apple's iOS also stays firmly in the lead as the platform where users are most likely to pay for apps. Apple's $40 billion in revenue is expected to come from 30 billion downloads. Google Play's $21 billion will come from 114 billion downloads
column11: making Apple's App Store a much more lucrative prospect for developers.The App Annie numbers show that Android's sheer numbers advantage
column12: however
column13: is once again showing results.Apple App Store Revenue ExplainsSuper Mario RunOne of the best recent examples of how the difference between appdownloadsversus apppurchasesplays out wasNintendo Co.
column14: Ltd (ADR)'s(OTCMKTS:NTDOY)Super Mario Run.This was Nintendo's first full-fledged foray into mobile gaming. Built around one of the most recognizable Nintendo characters of all time
column15: smartphone ownerssalivated at the chance to play.When the game was released in 2016
column16: if one platform was going to have an edge at getting Mario first
column17: sheer numbers would say it should have been Google Play. With more than double the downloads of the Apple App Store
column18: Google Play would have putSuper Mario Runonto a lot more devices. But Nintendochose to make Super Mario run an iOS exclusiveinstead.Despite there being far fewer iPhones out there than Android smartphones
column19: AAPL's App Store revenue shows that those iPhone users are far more likely topayfor a game. Android users had to wait until last week to finally get their hands on the title. And that's been the model that many premium app developers continue to follow
column20: despite Google Play's numbers lead.If it's a high-profile app that cost a lot to develop and you expect people to pay for it
column21: the Apple App Store tends to get it first - if Google Play gets it at all.Will the Shift to Android Dominance Hurt Apple?Services - which includes App Store revenue - has become anincreasingly important division for AAPL. It posted the highest growth of any of Apple's divisions last year and AAPL netted $3 billion in revenue from app downloads last December alone.Is that revenue in jeopardy? That shouldn't be the case
column22: for three reasons.First
column23: the Apple App Store is expected to remain comfortably on top as the single largest app store for revenue through 2021.Second
column24: a huge chunk of the revenue growth on the Android side is coming from third party Chinese app stores. These tend to be focused on that market
column25: and don't compete against the West.Third
column26: every year it gets more difficult and more expensive to develop and support apps for Android. There are so many versions of the operating system in use and so many different smartphones running it that testing and ensuring a good user experience - something that's critical for premium apps - is time consuming
column27: costly and still doesn't guarantee results.Bottom Line on Apple's App StoreApple has weathered a number of negative milestones as a result of the sheer numbers of Android users. In 2011
column28: the number of Android smartphones leapt past the number of iPhones in the American market. In 2013
column29: Google Play took the lead in the number of app downloads for the first time. And in 2015
column30: the Apple App Store was surpassed by Google Play for having the most apps available.If Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Has a Shot at a Breakout
column31: This Is ItDespite the dominance of Android smartphones
column32: App Store sales continue growing at a healthy pace
column33: and it's expected to keep doing so despite the latest stat. According to App Annie's predictions
column34: that means growth to $40 billion in revenue this year and $60 billion by 2021 (compared to $78 billion combined for Android). Not bad for a platform expected to see appdownloadsat that time outnumbered 7-to-1 by the competition.As of this writing
column35: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe 7 Best REITs to Buy for Big (And Growing!) Yields3 Stocks to Buy Before Slow-Growth Dinosaurs Nab ThemThe postApple Inc. (AAPL) Will Lose Its App Store Crown to Androidappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Best Stocks for 2017: Albemarle Corporations (ALB) Outlook Remains Bullish;3/30/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsEditor's note: This column is part of ourBest Stocks for 2017contest. Matt McCall's pick for the contest isAlbemarle Corporation(NYSE:ALB).makeArticleAd();It's hard to believe it has already been more than three months since I was introduced toInvestorPlace.com'sBest Stocks for 2017 contest. As Imentioned then
column3: picking just one stock to outperform for the year ahead is a daunting task
column4: but it was a challenge I was more than willing to take on! I'm very pleased to say that my top-down strategy
column5: which puts a heavy focus on industry groups
column6: pointed me in the right direction.My pick for the best stock of the year isAlbemarle Corporation(NYSE:ALB)
column7: a global specialty chemicals company that is a leader in lithium
column8: bromine
column9: refining catalysts and applied surface treatments. It's one of three major global players in the lithium sector and owns lithium brine operations in Chile and the United States
column10: as well as a stake in a mine in Australia.How ALB Stock Has Been FaringAlbemarle has spent the first quarter hard at work expanding its lithium business to keep up with rising demand around the globe. In January
column11: it amended an existing agreement with the Chilean Economic Development Agency to extend the terms out 27 years.The agreement is expected to more than triple the lithium quota in Chile.Then in March
column12: ALB stock'sTalisonjoint venture in Australia approved an expansion of its lithium production at its Greenbushes mine
column13: which will double the current output.The 7 Best Stocks to Buy for an Income-Rich RetirementFrom a top-down view
column14: chemical companies with exposure to lithium will continue to be the best-positioned in the current environment
column15: and I like that Albemarle is at the forefront of the industry. Plus
column16: a strengthening global economy will boost the chemical sector overall.ALB stock has also kept up its solid earnings track record
column17: reporting fourth-quarter numbers that beat the Street in February. Adjusted earnings of 78 cents a share werebetter than the expected75 cents a share
column18: and revenue of $696.7 million bested estimates of $646.4 million.On the conference call
column19: management said that ALB's 2016 performance and strategic initiatives have positioned it well for strong growth in 2017. For the full year
column20: they guided for earnings of $4-$4.25 a share
column21: a 17% year-over-year increase at the midpoint
column22: on revenue of $2.8 billion-$2.95 billion. And the growth isn't limited to just next year. Looking out even further to 2018
column23: management expects to increase profit by another 16%.In the end
column24: I think those estimates are too low and suspect the company will continue its trend of beating the Street's expectations. The latest report from ALB stock was taken very well by the market and the stock soared to a new all-time high the following day.The Albemarle Stock ChartLooking at ALB from a technical perspective
column25: you can see that the shares have been consolidating their gains following the post-earnings rally:The breakout to new highs has been confirmed
column26: as the stock has not pulled back since its gap to the upside
column27: and that's even more bullish when you consider the fact that ALB stock has been trending higher even as it consolidates.If Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Has a Shot at a Breakout
column28: This Is ItAlbemarle has gotten off to a great start in 2017 - it's up 23% year to date! - and I expect the higher highs to keep on coming.ALB stock remains a favorite of mine for this year and beyond.Matthew McCall is founder and president of Penn Financial Group
column29: an investment advisory firm. Matt also is Editor of FUTR Stocks and the ETF Bulletin. Earlier this year
column30: Matt and Hilary Kramer teamed up onBreakout Stockswhere Matt serves as the Co-Editor. Most recently
column31: Matt and Hilary joined forces again. This time
column32: they are helping individual investors make money trading ETFs. For more on their latest project
column33: visitwww.etfedgesummit.com.More From InvestorPlaceThe 7 Best REITs to Buy for Big (And Growing!) YieldsThe 10 Best ETFs to Buy for the Rest of 2017The postBest Stocks for 2017: Albemarle Corporation's (ALB) Outlook Remains Bullishappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Software Update 8.1 Includes Autopilot 2.0
column2: Sketch Pad;3/30/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) has released its 8.1 software update and it includes some new features.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockOne of the major updates that came with 8.1 was the addition of more features for Tesla Inc's Autopilot 2.0. This includes the ability to use the Autosteer feature while going 80 mph. The previous limit was 55 mph.While the Autosteer update is out
column4: it will still be a couple of days before owners of a Tesla Inc vehicle can use it at 80 mph. This is due to thecameras on the car needing calibration. The calibration will take place over the next few days during normal driving.There's also another couple of changes that come to Autopilot 2.0 in the 8.1 software update. The first is Auto Lane Change
column5: which lets users change lanes with Autosteer by using a turn signal. The second new feature is called ""Summon"". It lets owners park and pull out their vehicles from parking spaces without the need to be in them
column6: reportsElectrek.The electric car company also hid a fun feature in its 8.1 software update. If users tap the company's logo on the vehicle's touchscreen three times
column7: it will bring up a Sketch Pad for them to draw with. The secret feature wasrevealed by Tesla Inc CEO Elon MuskonTwitter Inc(NYSE:TWTR).The 7 Best Stocks to Buy for an Income-Rich RetirementTesla Inc also added a few other small features in the 8.1 software update. They include ratings and details fromAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column8: GOOGL)Google for businesses in the Mapsoption
column9: a Favorites option for radio streaming and a change to the headrest adjustment option.More From InvestorPlace5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Sell in AprilThe 10 Best ETFs to Buy for the Rest of 2017The 7 WORST Stocks to Buy Right NowThe postTesla Inc (TSLA) Software Update 8.1 Includes Autopilot 2.0

column1: If Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Has a Shot at a Breakout
column2: This Is It;3/30/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) stock could either go gangbusters over the next few weeks or it could simply go bust. How's that for non-commital?makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockSee
column4: Tesla shares are toying with a huge technical line in the sand extending back to 2014. This is the fourth distinct approach of the potential ceiling around $286
column5: and though Tesla stock failed to hurdle the resistance with its first three efforts
column6: this fourth try is starting out with a distinct advantage the first three swings didn't have.That is
column7: it's starting the run by blasting off a much higher launch pad. That just may be enough to make the difference. Or not.Tesla Isn't an InvestmentIt's been said before (by yours truly)
column8: but it bears repeating: TSLA stock isn't an investment
column9: but rather
column10: a trade based on a guess of how the market is going to collectively feel about the company six months in the future.It's becoming more investment-like
column11: to be fair
column12: now that consistent profits are at least on the radar and the recurring fundraisers seem to be slowing down as the company becomes more self-sufficient. It's still mostly a trade
column13: though
column14: so reading the technical tea leaves remains an integral part of the game.The 7 Best Stocks to Buy for an Income-Rich RetirementWith that as the backdrop
column15: the chart below tells the story quite clearly: Tesla stock has been range-bound since 2014. Trapped between $179 and $286
column16: with a minor floor at $195 occasionally playing a role. Eventually
column17: the ceiling at $286 is going to fail. Once that jailbreak happens
column18: a flood of would-be buyers could jump in and forge the beginnings of a sizeable melt-up.Click to EnlargeThis may well be the beginning of that move.What's so distinctly different about the bullishness that's materialized over the course of the past three weeks isn't difficult to see; unlike the prior two ceiling attempts
column19: this one didn't result in a slide to the lower edge of the trading range. This one only peeled back to $242 (blue) before a floor was made. The three-week rally pushed up and off that support line.It's encouraging simply because rather than being forced to traverse the whole $107 span between $179 and $286 and then be expected to have enough gas in the tank to keep on truckin'
column20: TSLA stock is only going to need to travel $44 before reaching the ceiling at $286.There's apt to be enough buying interest (and less profit-taking pressure) with that scenario than there has been with the other encounters with $286
column21: setting up a possible breakout. If TSLA can just clear the ceiling
column22: it could spark a move on the order of 100 points or so  roughly the same height of the well-established trading range it's trying to break out of now.Bottom Line for TSLA StockObviously
column23: there are never any guarantees. Tesla stock is a particularly funny bird to trade simply because everyone - professional and amateur alike - has a strong opinion on it. That kind of tension can pull the rug out from underneath any conventional technical analysis. The stock may simply bump into $283 and do what it's done the past two times - rollover.By and large
column24: TSLA has actually behaved pretty predictably for the past several years - in terms of technical analysis - so it wouldn't be crazy to put this potential trade on your radar. The company's certainly got more going for it now
column25: fundamentally
column26: than it ever has before.Ford Motor Company (F) Stock Is About to Get Even BloodierThe one often-overlooked clue you'll want to look for is better buying volume during and shortly after any break past $286. We don't quite see enough bullish volume yet
column27: though it could very likely materialize as TSLA stock approaches and then starts to clear the big technical ceiling.As of this writing
column28: James Brumley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace3 Construction Stocks That Aren't Making You Great Again5 Energy Stocks to Buy as They Power UpThe postIf Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Has a Shot at a Breakout
column29: This Is Itappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column42: Elon Musk's Brand New Company?Elon Musk
column43: the man behind electric car company Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA-Free Report) and rocket and spacecraft manufacturer SpaceX
column44: is launching a new company dedicated to creating devices that can be implanted in the human brain. DubbedNeuralink
column45: the venture aims to eventually help humans merge with computer software in order to keep pace with artificial intelligence advancements
column46: according toThe Wall Street Journal.Neuralink is looking to develop something called ""neural lace technology
column47: which involves implanting electrodes into human brains that allow for the uploading and downloading of thoughts to a computer. TheWSJreport discusses how this technology could improve human cognitive function
column48: and that Neuralink wants to explore how to alleviate the symptoms of chronic medical conditions
column49: like depression
column50: epilepsy
column51: and even Parkinson's.Musk
column52: it seems

column54: he said that ""Over time I think we will probably see a closer merger of biological intelligence and digital intelligence."" Musk thinks human beings need to help advance the ability to communicate directly with machines
column55: or basically risk irrelevance.Even last year
column56: at Vox Media'sCode Conference
column57: Musk brought up the potential benefits of neural lace technology
column58: something that is surgically connected to a human brain and allows users to interact with a computer without the need for input methods like keyboards or trackpads.Neural lace could prevent people from becoming ""house cats"" compared to artificial intelligence
column59: says Musk. ""I don't love the idea of being a house cat
column60: but what's the solution? I think one of the solutions that seems maybe the best is to add an AI layer. A third
column61: digital layer that could work well and symbiotically

column1: Why Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Will Keep Jumping Higher;3/29/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsEarlier this month
column3: Nvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) announced the Jetson TX2
column4: which is the latest iteration of the TX1
column5: which NVDA describes as""the world's first supercomputer on a module.""The company designed the Jetson module as a tool to assist developers in advancing and creating new technology. Additionally
column6: in partnership withMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column7: Nvidia announced development of theHGX-1 Hyperscale GPU Accelerator
column8: which promises improved performance and standardization for cloud-computing servers.makeArticleAd();Source: NvidiaThese tools will also serve NVDA stock investors (indirectly
column9: of course)
column10: as they further the company's rise to the top of the AI industry ladder.Android Centraldescribed the Jetson TX2 best
column11: saying:""The people who will build this technology of the future will need the tools to do so. In 2017
column12: NVIDIA is doing its part
column13: and the Jetson TX2 is the embodiment of this idea.""Simply put
column14: the Jetson TX2 is a mini supercomputer that can process massive amounts of data on the spot
column15: which can be a huge advantage for technology developers who would otherwise have had to upload all that data to an online server for cloud computing.10 Small-Cap Stocks That Could Double in the Next 3 MonthsWhat's more
column16: NVDA's Jetson TX2 is capable of ""edge"" machine learning
column17: a term that refers to the ability of the module to process
column18: interpret and analyze data without the need to first upload it to the cloud
column19: then download the resulting information and details. The TX2 has served its purpose quite successfully and it has helped Nvidia achieve its goal of simplifying developers' processes by reducing the number of steps required to garner important data.As far as the HGX-1
column20: NVDAbelievesthat:The HGX-1 hyperscale GPU accelerator will do for AI cloud computing what the ATX standard did to make PCs pervasive today. It will enable cloud-service providers to easily adopt NVIDIA GPUs to meet surging demand for AI computing.More Iconic Brands Rely on NVDA Than You Might RealizeHistorically
column21: Nvidia has been known for its industry-leading graphics cards. But
column22: NVDA stock is much more than a computer GPU maker. Sure
column23: the company still produces some of the most advanced GPUs that make hardcore gamers drool
column24: but graphics processors are actually capable of much more.While high-end GPUs will
column25: obviously
column26: improve PC video quality and reduce or eliminate that annoying screen lag when you're playing a first-person shooter game
column27: they're also used for a surprising number of non-visual applications.For instance
column28: Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column29: NASDAQ:GOOGL) andTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) use Nvidia GPU technology in the development of their respective driverless cars.Volkswagen AG (ADR)(OTCMKTS:VLKAY) andDaimler AG's(OTCMKTS:DDAIF) Audi brand have also been using Nvidia GPU units in their own driverless vehicle development projects. These companiesuse the NVDA Drive PX2- which
column30: according toForbes
column31: shares the renowned Tegra Parker silicon as the Jetson TX2.Beyond just autonomous vehicles
column32: though
column33: Nvidia GPU devices have been used by medical scientists and pharmaceutical companies to investigate and better understand the effects of aging. Using GPUs made by NVDA
column34: biotech companies such asInSilicoemploy AI to analyze large data sets and""emulate human brain function""in an attempt to combat diseases related to old age and reduce the cost of healthcare.Why the Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Comeback Is Just BeginningSimilarly
column35: at its annual Open Compute Project summit earlier this month
column36: Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) announced a cutting-edge AI server dubbed Big Basin
column37: which features""no less than eight Nvidia Tesla P100 GPU accelerators.""Bottom Line on NVDA StockAll things considered
column38: Nvidia stock's meteoric rise in the field of artificial intelligence shows no signs of slowing. With the release of the Jetson TX2 module
column39: coupled with the upcoming HGX-1 accelerator
column40: NVDA stock has addressed - seemingly quite successfully - mobile/field R&D as well as the cloud computing needs of AI developers.For Nvidia stock
column41: this is a solid sign that the past year's 213% gains will continue.As of this writing
column42: Greg Gambone did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Clobbered Stocks to Buy That Are About to Get Red-HotThe 7 WORST Stocks to Buy Right NowThe postWhy Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Will Keep Jumping Higherappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column6: with the U.K. invoking Article 50 and officially starting the country's withdrawal from the EU.makeArticleAd();Heading into the open

column8: whileS&P 500futures dipped 0.05% andNasdaq-100futures have risen 0.02%.On the options front

column1: Is Daimler Stock a Good Way to Invest in Self-Driving Cars?;3/28/2017;"Self-driving cars are coming. In time
column2: the technology is   likely to transform the way we get around -- and it might even   transform cars (and trucks) as we know them.It's generally true that transformative changes bring   investment opportunities for those who are paying attention. So   how do we invest in self-driving cars -- or
column3: as they're properly   termed
column4: autonomous vehicles?I've been looking carefully at the public companies known to   be working on some aspect of autonomous vehicle technology
column5: in   search of good opportunities for investors to profit from these   changes. Lately
column6: I keep coming back to one that most U.S.   investors seem to overlook: The company that's credited with   inventing the car itself.makeArticleAd();The first car with (very limited) self-driving capability?     It wasn't a Tesla
column7: it was the 2014 Mercedes-Benz S-Class with     Daimler's Traffic Jam Assist system. Image source: Daimler     AG.Daimler is not just a luxury-car companyDaimler AG(NASDAQOTH: DDAIF) is mostly known to U.S. investors as the maker   of Mercedes-Benz luxury vehicles. That's an important part of the   company's business. But it's more than that: Daimler is also a   major global producer of medium and heavy trucks and buses under   several brands
column8: including Freightliner and the Mercedes-Benz   commercial-vehicle brand.Why is that important? Daimler appears to be well along in the   process of developing its own autonomous-vehicle system. Daimler   has been investing in autonomous-driving research and development   for many years. The company will always have the distinction of   being the veryfirst to bring a hands-off-the-steering-wheel   system to market
column9: on the 2014 Mercedes-Benz S-Class sedan.It's also making big investments in (and good progress with)   battery-electric drivetrains. Both technologies have obvious   near-future applications in luxury cars
column10: of course
column11: asMercedes gears up to push back against   upstartTesla(NASDAQ: TSLA)  over the next few years.But the more significant opportunity for Daimler over the next   several years may be in automated (and eventually
column12: electrified)   long-haul trucking. Daimler may well lead that transition: Among   other efforts
column13: it has been testing a system called ""Highway   Pilot"" that allowsautomated tractor-trailersto ""platoon
column14: or drive in a closely spaced
column15: automated convoy.Mercedes-Benz tractor-trailer trucks fitted with a prototype     of its Highway Pilot system are shown moving in an automated     platoon in a test last year. Note the position of the driver's     hands. Image source: Daimler AG.Think that technology might have commercial implications?   Absolutely. By the way
column16: Daimler is also gearing up to produce the   latest version of its electric light-duty truck (think of an   urban delivery van) and is working on electricheavy trucksthat will go into mass production in a few years.Daimler's Fuso eCanter is a battery-electric commercial     truck that will soon be available with battery packs up to 84     kWh. Image source: Daimler AG.Daimler
column17: together with rivalsBMW(NASDAQOTH: BAMXF)  andAudiand chip giantIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) also owns a piece of HERE. HERE is the mapping   company that began life many years ago as NAVTEQ. It's   significance now is that it is expected to be a key supplier   of the highly detailed maps that will be needed by the first   Level 4 autonomous vehicles. It's another piece of the   autonomous-vehicle puzzle that might prove significant in a few   years: The more maps a given self-driving system   has available
column18: the more places it will be able to go without   intervention from a human driver.To sum up: As a luxury-car maker
column19: Daimler is in a good   position to profit from the early stages of the self-driving   revolution (when autonomous capabilities might be an expensive   option on premium sedans and SUVs). But the bigger opportunity   for Daimler may lie in self-driving trucks
column20: whether urban   delivery vans or long-haul tractor trailers. Taken together
column21: there's potential for a significant bottom-line boost as the   technologies come to market over the next several years.Daimler as an investmentRight now
column22: Daimler has a price-to-earnings ratio of about 8.8
column23: making it a little undervalued by long-term automaker standards   (10 times earnings is more typical for an automaker in good   economic times).Daimler is expected to pay a dividend of 3.25 euros this year
column24: same as last year
column25: for a 41% payout ratio and a rich dividend   yield of about 4.6%. (That fat yield is another sign that the   stock might be undervalued.)Daimler's current management team is a strong one. Led by CEO   Dieter Zetsche
column26: the group has boosted the company's profit   margins over the last few years while making what appear to be   the right investments for the future.Long story short: If you're looking for ways beyond the   obvious to invest in the coming wave of autonomous cars (and   trucks)
column27: Daimler is worth a closer look.10 stocks we like better than Daimler AGWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column28: it can pay to listen. After all
column29: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column30: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column31: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and DAIMLER AG ORD wasn't one     of them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6
column32: 2017John Rosevearhas no position in any stocks mentioned. The Motley Fool owns     shares of and recommends Tesla. The Motley Fool recommends BMW     and Intel. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: Sears Holdings Corporation (SHLD) Stock Flies 20%
column2: Clobbers the Shorts;3/28/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsSears Holdings Corp(NASDAQ:SHLD) gained another 20% on Tuesday to extend an improbable run. SHLD stock
column4: which dropped 12% the day the retailer expressed doubt in its ""ability to continue as a going concern
column5: has since pushed nearly 40% higher.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart via FlickrWhat gives?Well
column6: despite the likelihood that this story will likely end with Sears bankrupt and Sears stock holders left with nothing
column7: institutional money has poured in
column8: and that has been enough to shake out a considerable short crowd.Specifically
column9: Fairholme Capital Management's Bruce Berkowitz purchased 287
column10: 000 shares of Sears stock between March 23 and March 27 for anywhere between $8.05 and $8.46 per share
column11: according to a filing out Monday. A second filing showed that Fairholme bought 614
column12: 000 shares between March 20 and March 22.CEO Eddie Lampert also gave his company a vote of wallet confidence with his own 526
column13: 000-share purchase between March 22 and March 24
column14: according to a Friday filing.5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Sell in AprilThose purchases set off a spark on the powder keg of shorts sitting in SHLD stock. Specifically
column15: more than 78% of Sears' float - which doesn't include what Lampert and Fairholme own - was held short as of the most recently available data. That's good for a short ratio of 7.5 - meaning it would take seven-and-a-half days of buying at average daily volume to clear out all the shorts in Sears.Surely
column16: they're trying.The big bets come as Sears' operational results become more and more comically awful. Revenues have sunk from $36.2 billion to $22.1 billion in just three years

SHLD sits on just less than $300 million in cash versus $3.6 billion in long-term debt - an increasingly untenable situation that seems destined to end in pain.Sears' ""going concern"" language is essentially a nod to that idea - and that despite its continued promises of a turnaround

column1: What is Neuralink
column2: Elon Musk's Brand New Company?;3/28/2017;"Elon Musk
column3: the man behind electric car company Tesla Inc.TSLAand rocket and spacecraft manufacturer SpaceX
column4: is launching a new company dedicated to creating devices that can be implanted in the human brain. DubbedNeuralink
column5: the venture aims to eventually help humans merge with computer software in order to keep pace with artificial intelligence advancements
column6: according toThe Wall Street Journal.Neuralink is looking to develop something called ""neural lace technology
column7: which involves implanting electrodes into human brains that allow for the uploading and downloading of thoughts to a computer. TheWSJreport discusses how this technology could improve human cognitive function
column8: and that Neuralink wants to explore how to alleviate the symptoms of chronic medical conditions
column9: like depression
column10: epilepsy
column11: and even Parkinson's.Long Neuralink piece coming out on@waitbutwhyin about a week. Difficult to dedicate the time
column12: but existential risk is too high not to.- Elon Musk (@elonmusk)March 28
column13: 2017Musk
column14: it seems
column15: has been interested in the relationship between humans and computers for a while now.Speakingat the World Government Summit in Dubai in February
column16: he said that ""Over time I think we will probably see a closer merger of biological intelligence and digital intelligence."" Musk thinks human beings need to help advance the ability to communicate directly with machines
column17: or basically risk irrelevance.Even last year
column18: at Vox Media'sCode Conference
column19: Musk brought up the potential benefits of neural lace technology
column20: something that is surgically connected to a human brain and allows users to interact with a computer without the need for input methods like keyboards or trackpads.Neural lace could prevent people from becoming ""house cats"" compared to artificial intelligence
column21: says Musk. ""I don't love the idea of being a house cat
column22: but what's the solution? I think one of the solutions that seems maybe the best is to add an AI layer. A third
column23: digital layer that could work well and symbiotically
column24: he said at the conference.TechCrunchpoints out that this is pretty much how Tesla and SpaceX started: a key product grounded in one big
column25: grand idea. Mass-produced
column26: long-range electric vehicles and sustainable energy? Check. Landing and colonizing Mars? Check. Taking on artificial intelligence by turning into a semi-robot? We'll see.More Stock News: This Is Bigger than the iPhone!makeArticleAd();It could become the mother of all technological revolutions. Apple sold a mere 1 billion iPhones in 10 years but a new breakthrough is expected to generate more than 27 billion devices in just 3 years
